summary: Offline and always ad-free - stream in the highest quality available.

scraped_reviews.content: The library and quality of audio on Tidal, and the utility (like importing other services' playlista) are great. But the app, at least for my Android on a flagship Galaxy device, SUCKS. it freezes and crashes constantly on a stable high speed internet connection as well as on 5G. I haven't switched to something else just because the politics of the competitors are bad but it's super frustrating especially considering how expensive it is. can't use it as party music etc as it's so unreliable.

After having Tidal for several years, I canceled my subscription. The app stopped playing music when I wasn't connected to WiFi even when I had great cellular service (and an unlimited data plan). Only downloaded tracks worked... kinda ridiculous. When I went to YouTube music to stream the same song it played immediately. It wasn't a service issue. I do like the layout of the app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. We're constantly looking for ways to improve our features, such as the search function. If you have any inquiries or experience any issues, please contact TIDAL Support at support.tidal.com.

scraped_reviews.content: Generally speaking, the app works alright. It still isn't quite as fluid or "pretty" as Spotify, but that's okay. Lately it seems that if I am listening via Tidal Connect, then stop for a while & it disconnects, it doesn't work right the first time I reconnect. For instance, I reconnected and kept playing the same song, then when I tried to change to a new song, it disconnected and jumped to the middle of the new song?? To be clear, updating did not fix this.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback about the TIDAL app, but we‚Äôre sorry to hear you experienced an issue with TIDAL Connect. Please try updating your device's firmware, resetting your device, resetting your home WiFi network, and updating the TIDAL app to the latest version. TIDAL Support can always help at support.tidal.com.

scraped_reviews.content: Unmatched sound quality, excellent curated playlists, fantastic UI. It's only flaw, down right terrible search algorithm. Almost inexcusably bad. I thought there would be no way I would leave Spotify. After spending so long listening to CD quality music, Spotify sounds like garbage. This becomes more apparent using premium speakers or headphones. Fix the search algorithm for the love of God.

Fantastic music quality and so glad they pay more per stream to the artist. The glaring UI issues, interruption of songs, not being able to control Tidal on another device from your phone, slow loading no matter the Wi-Fi or connection you have kept me off the app though. You shouldn't have to download third party software to get an app to work properly. I love this app and streaming service but the system needs to be fixed.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. We‚Äôre glad you enjoy the sound quality and the support for artists, but we‚Äôre sorry to hear you experienced technical issues. TIDAL Support can always help at support.tidal.com. We‚Äôll also be sure your feature request gets in the right hands.

scraped_reviews.content: love it for the most part... but I was trying to make a big playlist of all my other playlists to download to listen to at work and unfortunately it just adds additional instances of songs instead of skipping over ones that are already there. I've got Smash Mouth's "I'm a Believer" on there like 6 times now. And I'd just begrudgingly delete the duplicates, but every time you delete a song from the list, it shoots you back up to the top. please consider fixing that. thx

App has so much potential. I'm not to picky about what is included in these steaming apps, but the app crashes a lot, or just won't work, which is really frustrating for me because I use music apps a lot. if that could get fixed, I could rate higher. it has potential to be a great alternative to other big streaming services, especially considering who some of those services CEOs are accepting money from, and what they're advertising for. Still, this will be my main streaming app.

As I write this review I was already expecting the app to crash. I can take the wonky UI, I can accept the music limitations against Spotify, I don't mind the price, but everything was overshadowed by the apps constant crashing. Its ridiculous. Sometimes 2 mins, sometimes 15, and even seconds! I'm so tired of it, I joined this app so I could help support the artists but I can't. I'm going back to Spotify as much as I don't want to, because at least I can trust the app won't crash.

Been enjoying Tidal now for about 6 months. Pretty good service overall, love the high quality streaming! Only thing missing is a dedicated Samsung TV App!! I'm forced to use the internet app and that doesn't allow gapless playing or Dolby Atmos, which would be nice considering most soundbars today take advantage of that. Yes, I can use Bluetooth with my phone, but then its not a direct connection. Having an app on the TV would be the best option!

I switched from Spotify and It's appealing to me to have something so similar. some things that are weird: I wish there was a history playback of songs i listened to. I couldnt find some artists until i had somehow found they are here just duplicate profiles. maybe not tidals fault, idk. Finally i wish i can see and control the music from phone to pc (how Spotify does it). the $2 for an extra 60 days was really nice but at this point I've been using it for longer than that and still am using it!

Works fine but I wish that the volume leveler function from the phone app were also available here, as some songs I can barely hear only to be blasted into oblivion by the next. Additionally, I've created a seperate family profile for the TV and it was purely a "video profile", i.e., all my suggested playlists were just video playlists, which I absolutely hated. Then I logged into the new profile in Chrome browser, and the profile turned normal. I suggest you also add a switch for profile type.

The sound quality is great and the selection is most of what you're looking for, even some more obscure jazz, metal, or hip-hop. No ICE/Nazi advertisements. They have a HARD LIMIT of 10k liked songs, which is an enormous problem. I'm bringing 18k+ songs from sportify, so it's almost a deal breaker to lose half of the collection, AND the worst part is that I can never again "like" a song because it errors and removes the like. I'm not really trying to delete 10,000 songs from my catalog ü§∑üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

This is an awesome app + they pay artist well!! - song playlists and daily suggestions are way better than Spotify. I feel like I've discovered more new music in two weeks than I have in a while. The audio connection over Bluetooth to speakers can be a little weird, I've had a few random disconnections and sound breaking up - but great quality with headphones.

This used to be a really great app. please fix the mobile issues. 4g my music plays fine wifi plays fine. As soon as i hit 5g or 5g uw problems, i cant play music. i can play downloaded tracks, but thats it. please fix it it used to work fine. Another thing i HATE is when i have music in my Playlist that disappears. why make the track accessible then delete it and keep me from playing it. and paying more money to use with my dj software, even tho i already pay. Spotify sounding really good.

This is a decent Spotify alternative! It has a lot of great features, but lacks some basic ones, such as: -button to add songs to playlists (on the playlist) -when adding songs to playlists, no option to search for specific playlist -button to block artists or tracks as someone who uses playlists a lot and have uploaded my entire library from Spotify, this is a nightmare to navigate! Good app but with some tweaks it could be great!

A solid replacement for Spotify for music. I've found almost all my fairly obscure music as well as mainstream stuff, and there's a handy website that syncs/imports your existing likes and playlists from any major platform. I also find their suggested songs to be good I haven't found out how to view All Liked Songs, so make sure you save everything in at least one playlist! The only notable gap in features is that I wish they hosted podcasts too.

I switched from Spotify after using Spotify since 2016 because I don't like funding genocide. I've been using Tidal for over a month now, I can safely say it's got a few problems. Music stops on mobile constantly ( Samsung Note 20 ) I learned I have to keep the screen turned on for it to not stop randomly. UI is not the best, and it's all jumbled up. No sleep timer? I do like how they built on recommending other user playlists more. On PC this app works perfectly and I have no complaints.

In most ways, it's fine. Music quality is good, it's usually reliable, nice range of music available, etc. Algorithm is pretty mid & replays the same songs a lot in all playlists, but that seems industry standard these days. However, my biggest complaint: the android app is missing the ability to repeat one or all tracks. This means that I'm constantly having to restart the music. From looking online it seems like the iOS version has this ability -- why in the world doesn't android?

Love the layout of the app itself. The two things I hate most is how repetitive the app is when playing songs, it will play the same song multiple times in a short time and will also play the same artist multiple times. Another issue I've had, the app will stop playing music or close all together even when I'm connected to wifi

Any app that pops up mid-use more than once to beg for reviews gets 1 star. The constant 'want to listen to this artist/genre we're pushing that you've never expressed interest in?' pop ups are annoying too. Is it too much to ask for a program that does -WHAT I ASK- exclusively and nothing else? That said, not SpotICEfy, so actually 3 out of 5 stars otherwise.

The app stops at least once every time I use it. An error message comes up, (0:500:999) but I don't know what the problem is. Happens even when connected to wi-fi. Especially annoying while driving. Often, it doesn't reconnect. Shuffles playlists when you haven't set it to shuffle. I wouldn't go back to Spotify, but I will see what else is out there. Tidal is a letdown. They recently changed terms, but the link to see the changes doesn't work.

Artist availability and quality of sound is fine. However, the user interface is terrible. I really wanted this to work as a replacement for Spotify, but I just keep having issues with the App. For example, I forgot my password and cannot even reset it because the verification email never reaches my inbox. Yes, I checked the spam folder and nothing. I reached out to customer support and days later still no answer. I cannot even cancel my subscription, therefore uninstalling for lack of support.

I've been using tidal for several years now, and while I'm fine with the service I would never recommend it to anyone. The platform is plagued with AI music, music from different artists on the same page, or sometimes missing music all together. The changes in the past few years have been good, and the app is getting better. The app on Android runs very smoothly for me, and I haven't experienced any bugs. The desktop app on Windows however is very slow.

I've had Tidal for years because of the fidelity. However, this app has been absolute garbage as of late. I constantly get connection errors while driving my car and listening to music. I have to literally toggle my mobile data off and then back on in order to play music again. This is extremely irritating. I've cleared cache, deleted app data, reinstalled, etc. I did recently upgrade to a Fold 7 from a Fold 5 and I don't recall if this was going on before when I had the Fold 5.

music quality is great; however lacking in social aspects that made spotify fun. for example, you can't collaborate on playlists with friends. but most annoying of all is how buggy the app is - connection issues, (regardless of playback quality) for no apparent reason when other streaming apps have no problem, playlists becoming inaccessible or taking ages to load. desktop app seems to work great, but leaving much to be desired for a mobile substitute for an ice free listening option.

I switched from Spotify to Tidal, and it was definitely the right decision! the music quality is way better, and it's super easy to use on both desktop and PC. The recommendations are fantastic too! I've found tons of awesome new music in just the few weeks I've been using it. Highly recommend!!

works great on wifi. on mobile data, the app occasionally stops playing music. nothing makes it resume--pause/play, skipping tracks, switching Playlist, none of it. only fix I've found is to force stop the app. never had a problem with Tidal's competitors in the years that I've used them in the same areas. edit: removing a couple stars because a week later, the problems on mobile data appear to be the norm

Amazing quality, but they're too elitest to be convenient. The app doesn't support local file playback/organization, which is extremely important to me when dealing with a subscription to something that doesn't have every piece of content available. I can't play music that they don't have without switching to a different app. That may sound like it makes sense, but it's terribly inconvenient and goes against the point of having a music app.

serviceable music streaming app when it works but it crashes nearly every time i try to listen to music for more than a few minutes. this app is nearly unusable. for what its worth, the music selection is definitely more limited than other streaming services too. but that doesnt matter as much to me as being completely unable to listen to anything or access my account because the app is too broken to use.

good audio quality. Very annoying issue where my music will undownload, and the only solution I've found is to uninstall and reinstall, then redownload. Also, locking basic functionality behind premium like the search bar sucks. Now that my trial has ended the app has essentially bricked itself and won't play any music and has started simply prompting me to purchase premium.

You can't store your own stuff even on your own device through the app. I'm switching off soon. They can't even play the music from a playlist they created! It took 2 songs for them to abandon it! I've used Tidal for like a year and have never seen an update. The music stops randomly all the time. You cannot trust it to just run. They do not care about the user.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. We‚Äôre glad that you enjoy the music on the TIDAL app, but we‚Äôre sorry to hear you experienced issues. We're always working to improve the recommendations, and we appreciate your comments. To receive assistance, report bugs, and more information, please feel free to reach out to TIDAL Support at support.tidal.com.

scraped_reviews.content: Usually the app is very good! Recently they pushed an update that broke my app from working for about a week, which received no acknowledgement from Tidal here, or on Twitter, not any reimbursement for the downtime. Otherwise the app is good, though some new releases can take a while to show up, the overall sound quality is good and the My Mixes work well for the different types of music I like to listen to.

The only reason I returned to this app after a previous trial was to listen to new Dolby Atmos songs. I had enjoyed some Atmos songs before on Tidal, using the same phone and Bluetooth headphones. Unfortunately, this time around, with the same setup, I got an error message saying Atmos isn't compatible with my device. Not sure how it was compatible several months ago, but isn't now. Since I can't listen to Atmos anymore, I have no need for Tidal.

The follow function never works!! I follow a band I love because I want their music to show up in my feed but it never does. I navigate to that band page and AGAIN click follow. Why am I not following any bands that I love? I go to their pages and click follow many many many times.... But their music only plays for me if I specifically search because the follow function does not seem to work at all!!! It has been well over a year, and the follow function STILL DOES NOT WORK.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. We‚Äôre sorry to hear you experienced an issue with the follow function. If you still need help, TIDAL Support is always available at support.tidal.com.

scraped_reviews.content: favorite music app. wishing the recommendations would be on the home page like it used to be. that is where I start my day. instead of me having to hit the search icon to know what's new. almost missed jay electronica's five albums if someone didn't text me about it. I was like why didn't tidal push this to me, thats my genre I listen too. when I hit search it was all over the place plus other music I almost missed. tidal is still my favorite music app I ever had but these are just my thoughts.

Great sound quality. Decent algorithm for suggestions - still inferior to Spotify but definitely better than Qobuz. The deal breaker for me is the app behavior - unlike Spotify Tidal forgets where I have left off especially when switching between listening directly on my phone and on Android auto in my car. Very often I drive off and just then I realize I have to choose again what to listen. It's not only annoying but dangerous. Fix that and you will get two more stars.

Enjoying the switch from Spotify, but the app will not allow me to "heart" any new tracks. Says there is an issue and to try again later. Edit 9/6/2025 The reason I cannot like anymore music is because I have reached the max of 9,999 liked tracks. That is absurd. The customer service rep suggested I unlike tracks to be able to like additional music... I wont be doing that. I will be switching services.

Please give us the option to turn off recommendations or just put our own playlists at the top when we open the app. I don't want to see "user playlists", I don't want to see "Uploads for you" from random indie artists I've never heard of, I want to see my music! And bring back the new drop sections for albums and singles from artists we listen to (or similar), back at the bottom of the home page like it used to be. Every new "update" just makes it more and more annoying to use.

it's a good app if you're willing to pay for the premium service, however not great for anyone looking to use the free features. You can only upload 500 songs from Spotify (unless ,once again, you want to pay an entirely different service to transfer those songs) and doesn't have a search bar feature. I also found that for half the time I had it, it only played 30 seconds of each song, and when I tried logging out and logging back in, it completely deleted all the tracks I had uploaded üôÉ

they charge you every 30 days. do not be mislead by their "monthly" notation on their terms and conditions because to them that means they can charge you every 30 days and if you get charged 2x in a month its ok. it had great sound, good selection and was a decent price for an actual 1x a month charge but they misrepresent themselves and tell you you need to be smarter when you question them. canceled and just waiting for what I paid for to expire so I can switch to a different service.

Works as expected for the most part. Issues I have are with Android Auto. First, when I power off my audio in my car, it should auto pause whatever is playing, but it doesn't. Minor issue. Big issue is that I can't select individual songs in an album or playlist from my car screen like I can with Spotify. It's a real problem. I'm guessing it's a "safety" measure but honestly, it's less safe because people are going to open their phones and select the track anyway. I do. PLZ FIX IT, then 5 stars!

This app is getting better... slowly. The biggest issue with the mobile app at this point is that when you attempt to add a song to a playlist, you can't see what playlists you already have that song in. It would also be nice if you could add images to playlists rather than just having the first four songs' album covers. The TV, Android Auto, and desktop apps have their own distinct issues as well.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're having issues with the TIDAL app. Connect with us to troubleshoot at support.TIDAL.com.

scraped_reviews.content: So far it seems like a nearly 1:1 replacement for Spotify, and fixes some of the gripes I have with Spotify. The big thing I miss from Spotify is the alarm clock integration. The search feature will also not pull up artists until you actually hit the enter button sometimes- it would be better if it just didn't preview an incorrect search. I love how light and easy to use it is to use and to organize music.

I get connection issues every 10 songs if I don't download them, even on the browser version on my PC. Once I get this error, I can't stream music for at least an hour. It really sucks because I would love to rate the quality of the app otherwise a solid 5 stars, but this connection issue makes it borderline unusable half the time, unless I fill my phone's hard drive with just music.

I like tidal as a service, however the app has no support for devices that are locked to landscape, such as my android headunit. There is no way for me to navigate back out of a song, without uninstalling and re-installing the app each time. The support staff have been incredibly unhelpful, deny any problem, and recommending the same boilerplate "fixes"; 80% of which I cannot do, as again, I can't navigate outside the current song. All it would take is to add 1 back button to the player.

Overall I like the service. There are 2 issues in particular that I dropped stars for. Some albums have issues with being way too quiet on android auto regardless of the normalize volume setting. It's to the point where I just can't listen to them when traveling. The other is recently I've had issues with the app pausing my music for network connection issues when I'm playing a downloaded playlist. This should never be an issue with downloaded music.

I've used this app for a week. Its has a somewhat noticeable difference in sound. It also is meant to pay its artist much more which I like. The deal breaker, however, is that the UI is absolutely terrible. The app doesn't allow you to visually see if a song is added to a playlist(unless it's your liked songs). It also is a pain to add and take songs out of your playlist. When I was trying to remove a song, it made me go to my playlist, scroll over 1000 to remove, instead of just clicking on it

Recently switched from Spotify and I feel good about it. Ultimately you gotta accept it's *not* Spotify, so there are gonna be some tracks and features missing but my mind is resting easy and the sound quality is definitely something to write home about. The one feature I really find myself missing that I am BEGGING the devs to implement is collaborative playlists. Let me build playlists with my friends and I'm 100% on board.

the app makes awful new music suggestions. it doesn't keep a chronological order of new music recommendations. an artist I listen to frequently might drop a song or album and it wouldn't be recommended. furthermore, people are uploading music under different artists names, but the songs are from said artist. the only positive I have from this app is sound quality and cheap price. but I guess I'm getting what I paid for.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your comments. If you have any additional feedback or require help, please visit us at support.TIDAL.com.

scraped_reviews.content: I just recently got the tidal free trial because my previous music service was having issues keeping content. I really like this app. They have a ton of music content, some of which you can't find on other streaming services. Also, the ui looks very nice and it is really easy to navigate. AND they even have a feature to transfer playlists over. Overall, very impressed and I will continue to use this service once my free month ends

title: Shazam: Find Music & Concerts
description:
Shazam can identify songs playing around you or in other apps, even with headphones on. Discover artists, song lyrics, and upcoming concerts‚Äîall for free. With over 2 billion installs and 300 million users worldwide!

‚ÄúShazam is an app that feels like magic‚Äù - Techradar.com (http://techradar.com/)

‚ÄúShazam is a gift... a game changer‚Äù - Pharrell Williams, GQ interview 

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know how we ever survived before Shazam‚Äù - Marshmello

WHY YOU‚ÄôLL LOVE IT

* Identify the name of songs in an instant.
* Your song history, saved and stored in one place.
* Open any song directly in Apple Music, Spotify, YouTube Music, and Deezer.
* Browse concerts by popularity or search by artist, location, and date.
* Follow along with time-synced lyrics.
* Watch music videos from Apple Music or YouTube.
* Get Shazam for Wear OS.

SHAZAM ANYWHERE, AT ANY TIME

* Use your Notification Bar to identify music in any app‚ÄîInstagram, YouTube, TikTok...
* Quickly identify songs from your Home Screen using the Shazam Widget 
* No connection? No problem! Shazam works offline.
* Turn on Auto Shazam to search for more than one song, even when you leave the app.

WHAT ELSE?

* Find out what is popular in your country or city with Shazam charts.
* Get recommended songs and playlists to discover new music.
* Listen to and add songs to Apple Music playlists.
* Share songs with friends through Snapchat, Facebook, WhatsApp, Instagram, X (formally Twitter), and more.
* Enable the Dark theme on Shazam.
* View a song's popularity by checking its Shazam count on the app.
* Explore songs similar to those you've discovered.

Optional App Permission

-Microphone: To identify a song that‚Äôs playing around you when you tap to Shazam.
-Location: To show you where your songs were identified, display upcoming events in your area, and improve the quality of the service.
-Notification: To send you notifications that are personalized based on your Shazam activity.

You can use Shazam even without providing consent to any of the above optional app permissions. However, some features of the service may not be available.

Availability and features may vary by country.
For more information on Shazam‚Äôs privacy practices, please read the Privacy Policy, available at: https://www.apple.com/legal/privacy/.

summary: Find songs, concerts, lyrics & videos. Play or connect to stream music now!

scraped_reviews.content: this app is amazing! it's extremely helpful when I'm trying to find the name of a song that I can't remember, or am hearing a new one for the first time on an ad, movie, out in public, whatever! the only complaint I have is it won't pick up on the song (through your phone) when you're wearing earbuds. besides that, great app! edit: I switched phones (I now have a newer samsung - s22 rather than an outdated galaxy) and now it will work with earbuds! no complaints now!

Please stop turning up results that are from a compilation album unless the song is a remix, because I'd like to know when it originally came out. This app is great! It gets songs fast and most times correct. Although sometimes they do get them totally wrong or unrelated, search it again and it will most likely get the right title, occasionally the wrong group though. What bugs me is that you can report a "wrong song" but can't specify what's wrong with it.

Doesn't pick up music played through my Bluetooth earbuds at the gym, which is where I'd love it to work. Instead, it picks up the awful gym music played in the surrounding speakers even though the Headphones icon confirms that it knows I'm wearing headphones. Frustrating. Other than that, Shazam's great, accurate around 90% of the time.

AMAZING APP! At first, I downloaded it after a recommendation from a friend not really thinking it'd be more than just finding songs here and there but it's so good. I was at a restaurant when a song came on from a TV while it was playing the show 'The Voice' so I used the Shazam app and not only did it find me the song but it pulled up the video to that 'The Voice' video on YouTube! I was blown away and haven't been able to stop using it now.

Ever since Apple bought Shazam it's gone down hill. Half of my 760 Shazams never pull up the video. It pulls up everything else but the video tile is blank. Then, there's a large part of songs that show the correct title in the library screen but when i open it up it's a completely different song. I used to really like this app but it's becoming more effort than it's worth.

5.8/10. I‚Äôve been using Shazam for almost 5 months, and now, it‚Äôs time to review it. It‚Äôs a great app for discovering some music/songs on the go (although they have some inaccuracies when Shazaming). However, other features like Auto Shazam, which I use the most in this app, sometimes refuse to continue, and it‚Äôs not like single result mode; it just disables automatically randomly (bug in the app). Another similar app is SoundHound, but it only detects songs in an app and not in the background.

This app used to be my go to when it came to finding the title of songs. Unfortunately, it seems to struggle quite a bit when it comes to songs in different languages or covers. Nowadays, Google's own "search a song" function has been MUCH more reliable at finding the title to tracks that I haven't been able to through Shazam. It's quite a shame and doesn't make this app worth having downloaded anymore for my use case.

I've been using it for the longest time because it's extremely useful app for me especially when listening to Trance gigs. It used to be so difficult & many times you're just waiting for someone to post the track listing before you can know the name of the track. Shazam came along & instantly became the game changer but for me it's also a life saver!

This app was something I feel like I wished into existence. I've had it since it came out and it nearly never fails to find what I'm looking for. It's a lifesaver in supermarkets, parties, or out and about when you hear a song come on you only heard once before and didn't know the name of. I've had the occasional issue of it finding songs that weren't the ones being "shazamed," but its, as said before, occasional and usually only when I try to get "deep-dive" stuff.

Pretty good overall, but since the new updates, even though I have it set to stay in my notification bar for convenience, after a while it'll go away and won't come back until I physically open the app again. Also it still gets a few songs wrong or just flat out gives up trying to figure out what they are every now and then, but I'm sure that'll be fixed as more time goes on (update: down to 2 stars because the problem is even worse now)

Good app, but for the last year or so the feature that has it vibrate when it finds the result has been intermittently not working. I'm disappointed by the amount of time I've spent trying to fix something that stopped working out of the blue, and it's always a shame when a company breaks their own stuff

This app has been great over the years, but recently, when I try to search / Shazam a song from a show or when it plays on the radio it doesn't show up," No results", would be plastered on my phone screen. It's a bit disappointing, or when I use another app like Google or YouTube or a dupe app, the song and with the artist pops up. Just to make sure it wasn't just my device, I used Shazam on three other devices to look for the song or a variety of songs, and it still didn't pop up.

Amazing app! Use it everyday, never had a problem with it. Works best if only the song is playing, like no background noise or talking. Also works as a great substitute for Spotify. Doesn't play all of the song, just a little bit of it (maybe that's different if there's some kinda premium version idrk) but yeah great app, highly recommend

Ludicrous bandwidth hog *even when it's not being used at all*. Installed this app to identify a song playing on my Chromecast from the same phone. Suddenly the Chromecast couldn't play for more than 2-3 seconds without buffering. Uninstalled and the Chromecast is back to normal instantly. And to reiterate, this is when Shazam isn't even supposed to be listening at all, even though it clearly still is. Awful and invasive.

The app searches the song near instantly, and is able to provide the lyrics for the song most of the time, with active listening it even helps you keep up with the music too which makes it perfect for Karaoke! There are other features as well that let's you save the songs you enjoy for later and even create your own library of those songs.

I dont usually do reviews, but I love the Shazam app. I use it almost every day. Since music is a huge part of everyday life, it's great having a tool to find the one song you hear at the supermarket/restaurant. Or settling a little debate between friends on which song is playing at the bar. One thing that is annoying me is that I have to continuously turn on my settings for the notification bar. When I came to make the review, I noticed I needed to update the app. Hopefully, it helps.

Anyone else having problems with Shazam working lately? Usually works great and I LOVE the app. But last couple of weeks it was not able to show Lyrics saying it was having trouble at the time. Now, it won't Shazam songs at all! It ALWAYS says it can't find the song, saved the info, and will provide song later. What's going on? It's not just coincidence... these errors are happening ALL the time now. I've even tried uninstalling and reinstalling, but nothing works. Please help!! Thanks.

Used to be a great app but since the update, nothing works. For one, you try to search up a really simple song and nothing comes up. Even when im connected to internet. Two, its insansly slow, its infuriating. And three, if you try to watch the music video, read the lyrics or look at other songs it just says "something is wrong, try again." And you actually do try again and the same thing comes up. If nothing is wrong with the app, don't make an update. Plain and simple.

This works very well! Within seconds it will find any song. You can use it any time, even when you are doing something else on your phone. After not being able to recognize a theme that had many talking in it, (which made it harder to identify).. It tried again not many days later, and found it! I was so happy and impressed I felt the need to rate this app!

8/11/24 Thought I'd try again. Still not finding any songs. All I'm getting is an error message 'We're having technical issues now. We will give you the result as soon as we can.' 4/19/24 Since the last update no songs can be found. Was a great app. Taking less than 3 seconds to find songs. Now, can't. Currently useless. Maybe they'll roll it back to when it worked.

This was a godsend. I was able to find sooo many songs. It worked perfectly-- until today. I was using this app and it kept saying "sorry, couldn't quite catch that." I tested a few songs that I knew it had to know (in case my song simply wasn't identifiable). It couldn't even recognize "Yesterday" by the Beatles or "Smooth Criminal" by Michael Jackson!!! Now I'm having a meltdown. I heavily depended on this app. Such an enormous disappointment... Excuse me now while I go scream into a pillow.

Overall, this app has helped me tremendously. Gone are the days of wondering "who is this band?". It gets it right every time. BUUUTTT the widget changed and I hate it. It's not the same color or look. I could resize it as just a big button, but not anymore. It's either a standard sized icon or a long search bar. I don't want to "look" for an app I need to use asap. Guess I'll just use it less...

Basically useless if you're trying to find the name of an obscure song. Really only works for mainstream songs, which is great and all but falls short of being impressive. Maybe if they put more effort into actively creating a database of every known song, not just the popular ones, this app would be more useful. For those of you thinking that's a ridiculous request, I would normally agree, but that is what Shazam is supposed to be for right?

The app stopped working about 5+ weeks ago. Now, all I get is a message saying, "There was a problem. We'll notify you later with the restult." ... it's been at least 5 weeks now, and obviously, from the lack of response from Shazam, they don't care about their customers. üòí ... the hell with this, I'm un-installing and going with a competitor.

Solid 10! It's so easy to use! I use Shazam to build my Spotify play lists. Hear something on the radio or in a store? SHAZAM! Grab that song now. You can move it over later, adding it where you want, search for a different version, etc. But, you lock it in now, with a quick screen tap. Not even a distraction. The ONLY thing I'd like to add to the app, would be the ability to search the library for previous Shazams of the same song, for faster deletion. A dozen incidents, is overkill.

This app is fantastic. It can recognize a wide variety of music, from movie sound tracks to video game musoc and of course all those songs you hear on the radio that make you go "man what is that song". I know I'm just one reviewer but i would like to request a feature. It would be neat if you could set the songs that you Shazam as your ringtones, contact ringtones and just basic ringtones. It would be extremely helpful, and it would defintiely bump the my personal rating from 5/5 to 6/5

Wrong songs almost every time. Not worth using! Almost every time I use this useless app, I can't find what I'm looking for. I can try the same song over and over with different results that are not even close to the song. This has heen done, both letting it listen through the app and microphone. It doesn't matter. It either won't find the song or not at all. Accuracy is abysmal. Don't rely on it if you want to find something that catches your ear. Yes, I even tested it with songs I know.

Update: Changed fm 4 to 2 stars. I used to LOVE this but now it takes multiple times to id a song & when I select lyrics it no longer follows each line along with the lyric. Playback is terrible; songs are jarbled & scratched up. Why? Good news is that it picks up songs easily through talking and other noises in stores when trying to id a song on store speakers. ***PLEASE fix the garbled playback & it'd be great if I could play the whole song through other music apps for Android!

I love this app & everything is perfect about it. However, I think they could add just a couple of things. I wish you could search your library. I think that and if you could manage your searches into folders of some kind would make the app complete. I'd like to use this for songs I want to download and the playlists I want to put them in. I hear a song I want to remember or know & I Shazam it. It'd be cool to be able to organize them at the same time prior to downloading them is all. Thanks!

This is definitely one of the best apps for identifying music. I still have a couple issues with it though. For one, the app has gotten much worse at identifying remixed versions of songs. Also, the app has been crashing rather frequently for me recently. It seems to happen when I'm using certain pairs of Bluetooth headphones.

It does what it says it does, and usually well! I'd normally give this app 5 stars because it works accurately and quickly, even for remixes and songs in tons of different languages. But lately when using it, the lyrics tab will pop up after the song has been identified and I can't get it to exit out without restarting my phone. Dragging it away doesn't work, and neither does the X button on the side. Very annoying!

I like the app, but I primarily use it when driving. When you first open it, it's simple to hit the large button so it will start listening. After it identifies the song athough, there's no easy way to reset it so that you can capture another song. The only way way to go back to the home screen is to tap a tiny arrow in the upper left corner. Trying to do this while driving is distracting and dangerous, and I wish they'd set it so you could swipe back to the home page.

Okay, I guess, but not very accurate. Too often doesn't have any idea of what the song is. I'd expect it for obscure songs, not for more common music. Maybe it is a difficult task to identify a song so.... Also liked it more when it would show me the album info. Now that's gone it is just one more bad change. One last thing. I don't trust applications that announce an update but don't indicate what the update is. Feels like there is something to hide.

In actuality, the app is good... but, it seems to have lost its touch. I could use the app to listen to some songs offline and expect to get the songs after I come back online, but it seem to just record and pop up the song and immediately erase it from the list. It's very frustrating. Plus, some of the songs it had identified just suddenly go missing! Please fix it.üôèüèº

I've been a long time user of shazam. I've always loved this app! I like that it opens fairly quickly and gets right to the point and allows you to push the button right away to start "listening" since I'm always in a hurry before the song changes. I have only had maybe like 5-6 songs that didn't come up, which sometimes can happen when songs are too new, so they will eventually be on here...or sometimes they're just too obscure so it's understandable. Never crashes for me either! üëçüëçüëçüëç

You have to fight with it in order to get any reading on songs through headphones, (even after update: have to blast the volume in order for a potential read) and even then, it's only accurate 40-35% of the time. I'm a little slow when it comes to trends, especially in music; so, I don't know the names to a lot of songs from Instagram so I just use it for that. conclusion, use it for fun. You'll be disappointed otherwise, unless you have really mainstream music tastes.

For finding popular songs on the radio or whatever, sure it does a great job. But as soon as you go to find music, far too often the proverbial hands are thrown up with a "No Results; Sorry we didn't quite catch that". The sole purpose of this is to ID songs, a feature built into some phones nowadays. This has to do a better job than what's built in to be worth keeping around. Being able to ID what's playing over headphones is a nice feature.

Picks up popular and well known songs easy enough, but not so much for less well known songs. In my experience, I've had this issue multiple times, across multiple phones; with nothing else seeming to cause the issue. It's nice for when I forgot the name of a new song, or some 90s jams, but doesn't work so well for discovering new songs.

Had to switch to it from TrackID which was discontinued a few years ago. Never satisfied with the performance. It fails to identify the correct track 30% of the time. It cannot identify a non-English (tried French, Spanish) for artists who aren't the top selling ones, nor can it find many classical music pieces. Will keep trying alternatives until I find something as good as how TrackID was.

I used to love this app. Does it work? yes. is it accurate? also yes. I won't give it more than 2 stars though, because since it was bought by apple, you can only download songs straight from the app through iTunes. So all of us android users that use things like Amazon music do not fully benifit from the app any longer. It's dumb, I probably won't keep this app much longer if it doesn't change back.

I love Shazam! ‚ù§Ô∏è I have "Shazammed" over 15,000 songs since I first installed the app 6 years ago and I still use it all the time! It helps that I zap almost every song I hear, especially when watching a movie I set it to auto. And it's so easy to go thru and delete the songs I don't want. I love the extra features like "view artist", this is how I've found a lot of the songs in my library. Paying for encore was well worth it!

This was my favorite tool when i was asked what song was playing, now it just throws up "Didnt quite catch that, try again" every. single. time. No matter how close or far I have it from the radio, and it doesn't even listen or think, it shows that after a second. I've tried uninstalling and reinstalling it, theres nothing else I can do. Disappointing.

It used to be good, but now when I'm trying to identify a song, well let's just say it has just gotten about 20 seemingly wild guesses in a row completely wrong, on the same song. Sometimes it takes like a split second to guess and it's something that sounds nothing like the song I am trying to ID. I think they are just trying to sell music because it's like "Here it is" only it's got a completely different beat, different instruments, different language, nothing even close, again and again.

So much better than google. Has an auto listening feature which I thought was dumb at first (it does hurt your battery) , but its perfect at parties or gatherings, turn it on and then every song is saved so you can find the one you like. When you hear a good one, you can instantly see what song it is. Detecting software is amazing as well. Always picks it up.

Sometimes I get the songs I'm actually looking for but most times it's just very inaccurate, like extremely very inaccurate. I'm forced to do the same process over and over until it does finds the right one. It's really annoying, like I'm using an audio of an unknown song then it just straight up gives me either a nursery rhyme or a podcast or something that isn't even a song. Despite all that, it still works, but mostly just a time waster though

This app has been used by me for years. it's so good that it can even detect a song at the end as the music is fading with almost no sound at all. If you have no internet connection it saves an offline version of the song then tells you what it is when youre back online. I recommend it very highly.

Still works well most of the time, but has hiccups now and then. Biggest issue is that when it doesn't find a song, I'll use the Google song finder function and it's clear that works much quicker and better than whatever Shazam is built on. Failed Shazam searches turn up in three beats of the song with Google. Volume supposedly too low to get a Shazam result is no issue with Google. I still like the Shazam app and try not to use Google for everything, but they need to step it up.

The app just uses the mic whenever it wants. Every time I change my settings it'd change itself back. I'd only know it did that because of the green dot on my screen and when I tap, it says that Shazam is using the mic even though I set it to not do that unless I'm using the app. The shortcut to Shazam songs also doesn't show up in my notification bar. Every time I put it back it'd disappear again after a couple days. Pretty annoying and inconvenient as I love to collect new songs.

Shazam worked great up until recently. Now it will not identify the most popular songs both old and new. It's infuriating. I figured it's a glitch and check for updates, but none are available. I noticed another reviewer mentioned Apple is sharing this app. I have a Google android phone, so hopefully one has nothing to do with the other. If this gets fixed I will be happy to change my review. In the meantime I'm looking for another app.

For the most part, it works really well. I don't use it a lot, but when I do use it, it's fairly efficient and accurate. At least when searching radio music. For less popular, more obscure/underground (I listen to metal) it often takes much longer to identify, if it identifies it at all, which I understand since it all seems to be identified through Apple Music. Something I would love to see, is the ability to rate the identified songs. Even just a thumbs up/down would be really helpful!!

title: Google Calendar
description:
Get the official Google Calendar app, for your Android phone, tablet, or Wear OS device to stay organized and plan your day. Make the most of your day with easy event creation, multiple calendars, customizable views, widgets, tasks, and more


With Google Calendar, you can:  
‚Ä¢ Get events automatically added to your Calendar from Gmail, including flight, hotel, concert, and restaurant reservations.
‚Ä¢ Go from using Calendar on your Android phone, tablet, or Wear OS device to your computer without missing a beat when you‚Äôre logged into the same Google account.
‚Ä¢ Consolidate and view Google Calendar events side-by-side with other calendars on your device, including Exchange. 
‚Ä¢ Keep family, friends, and colleagues in the loop with shared calendars, so they can view, add, or modify events. 
‚Ä¢ Quickly switch between month, week, and day views.
‚Ä¢ Stay on top of to-dos by creating and managing tasks alongside your events in Calendar.
‚Ä¢ Personalize your Google Calendar with light or dark mode or by color-coding your events.
‚Ä¢ Access and organize your task lists in a full-screen view right from the Google Calendar app.
‚Ä¢ Keep track of events or tasks while on the go with Google Calendar on Wear OS devices, which supports tiles and complications.


Google Calendar is part of Google Workspace, allowing you and your team to easily connect, create, and collaborate across all your favorite Google tools. You can: 
‚Ä¢ Collaborate in a hybrid work environment by adding a Google Meet video call to an Calendar event 
‚Ä¢ Get access to professional booking pages to easily book clients and customers*.
‚Ä¢ Schedule meetings with teammates by checking their availability or layering their calendars in a single view
‚Ä¢ Add your working location to your calendar to make it easier for your teammates to schedule meetings with you*. 
‚Ä¢ Keep everyone on track for a meeting by attaching meeting notes, pre-read materials, and other documents directly to a calendar event.
‚Ä¢ Use Google Calendar with confidence knowing it‚Äôs supported by Google‚Äôs enterprise-level privacy, user safety and data security.


Learn more about Google Workspace: https://workspace.google.com/products/calendar/


Follow us for more:
X: https://x.com/googleworkspace
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/showcase/googleworkspace
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/googleworkspace/

With Google Calendar, you can:
‚Ä¢ Get events automatically added to your Calendar from Gmail, including flight, hotel, concert, and restaurant reservations.
‚Ä¢ Go from using Calendar on your Android phone, tablet, or Wear OS device to your computer without missing a beat when you‚Äôre logged into the same Google account.
‚Ä¢ Consolidate and view Google Calendar events side-by-side with other calendars on your device, including Exchange.
‚Ä¢ Keep family, friends, and colleagues in the loop with shared calendars, so they can view, add, or modify events.
‚Ä¢ Quickly switch between month, week, and day views.
‚Ä¢ Stay on top of to-dos by creating and managing tasks alongside your events in Calendar.
‚Ä¢ Personalize your Google Calendar with light or dark mode or by color-coding your events.
‚Ä¢ Access and organize your task lists in a full-screen view right from the Google Calendar app.
‚Ä¢ Keep track of events or tasks while on the go with Google Calendar on Wear OS devices, which supports tiles and complications.


Google Calendar is part of Google Workspace, allowing you and your team to easily connect, create, and collaborate across all your favorite Google tools. You can:
‚Ä¢ Collaborate in a hybrid work environment by adding a Google Meet video call to an Calendar event
‚Ä¢ Get access to professional booking pages to easily book clients and customers*.
‚Ä¢ Schedule meetings with teammates by checking their availability or layering their calendars in a single view
‚Ä¢ Add your working location to your calendar to make it easier for your teammates to schedule meetings with you*.
‚Ä¢ Keep everyone on track for a meeting by attaching meeting notes, pre-read materials, and other documents directly to a calendar event.
‚Ä¢ Use Google Calendar with confidence knowing it‚Äôs supported by Google‚Äôs enterprise-level privacy, user safety and data security.


Learn more about Google Workspace: https://workspace.google.com/products/calendar/


Follow us for more:
X: https://x.com/googleworkspace
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/showcase/googleworkspace
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/googleworkspace/
summary: Make the most of your day with Google Calendar, part of Google Workspace

scraped_reviews.content: used this for years now. it's good. it needs more though. it needs to have moon phases, would help for those who keep track of it, be it for gardening/farming, photography, sky gazing, etc. also would be nice to have the option to add holidays from other cultures as not everyone solely celebrates only the ones shown. it would also be nice if there were more customizable color choices for the memos. no real complaints. I like that you get notifications for your memos as well.

To be honest, I only got this so that events would show up properly in my phone's default calendar. As it turns out, turning on the holidays for ALL countries and religions is a bad idea! I turned most of them off and it fixed my problem. The app itself is alright, but navigating the calendar itself is more annoying than what I want to deal with. It keeps snapping to the single day calendar when I just want to look at one holiday, and I haven't found anything for color-coding holidays.

Good app as usual by Google developers. Keep up the good work. Ext. please work on fixing background battery drainage. Even when I limit the battery usage in the background, battery still. drains rapidly. It seems that some developers are targeting the battery through other means in the software. Check on this because it's very frustrating knowing you just charged your phone to 100%, and in about an hour, it's down to about 80 -90 %.

very good way to keep organized. just two things I've noticed that would make it to 5 stars. 1 - ability to make different calendars from mobile, or if its already there easier to find. i dont like having to login on my laptop just to add one. 2 - allow tasks to have both sub tasks and repeat. being able to do only one or the other is frustrating.

I've used Google base apps on my Android phone for a very long time but since there have been a various amount of updates on my phone including Google apps I'm finding out that the Google calendar does not do what it used to do before and that is it used to allow you to set up a constant alarm as a reminder of an important events. I had an appointment this morning in which I used Google calendar to notify me of this but it didn't notify me via alarm like previous versions did. "Missed the appt".
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Lauro. Have a look at the steps in this guide to troubleshoot Calendar notifications: https://goo.gle/2H0Ag2o. In case the issue persists, please create a new thread on our Google Calendar Help Community for our experts to review: https://goo.gle/2QnxTMN. Thanks.

scraped_reviews.content: For the last few days, every time I click on the calendar to add an event, it switches which Google Account the event is created in! I have two accounts on my devices, and the primary one is always shown in the account switcher when I open the Calendar app. but the minute I click on the calendar to add an event it switches to the other Account and starts creating the event in the wrong account. this is infuriating! In years of using this app this has never happened before now.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Evan, Thanks for reporting this issue to us. We have identified and fixed the problem. We apologize for the inconveniences caused.

scraped_reviews.content: The fact that you can't add a calendar from within the app is ridiculous. I like to set up different calendars for different types of tasks (ie bills, appointments, events) and color code them to help me track easier. Having to use a browser instead of the native app is insane. Bite the bullet Google and just pay a developer for a week to implement this extremely basic, borderline necessary, feature.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Zach, thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: Awful. #1 - You can't set slightly more advanced repeats like every 2 weeks. #2 - tasks will stay on your phone until you acknowledge it, but events will just disappear. But you can't set a time range for tasks, that's only for events. So if you want to set a range for a thing so everyone can see a block of time taken, but you also want the phone alert to stay on until you acknowledge it, this app will not do it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Ryan. Thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: Incredibly frustrating. Full screen only is annoying. I can't click on the day of the month without it opening up onto my whole screen. Give us a half screen option that shows the entries below when a day is clicked and doesn't take away the whole month view. I like to be able to count the month out, eg how many pay days before this bill is due etc but it just keeps opening up! When you try to create a calendar entry it defaults to all day and I find it so hard to figure out how to set a time.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Millie, thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: I like the full screen widget. It helps me because of the color changing features. I put everything I need to do in blue or yellow and when it is complete I change it to green so I can easily see my progress. it gameifys it a bit making it something I continue to do. I set daily intentions, grocery lists, and everything I dont want to forget in there

I think the calendar app is great if you ONLY use Google for everything. Unfortunately, my work uses Microsoft for everything, and the integration with Exchange is terrible. I'll have events show as not accepted, they rarely sync well, etc. If devs could fix that integration so that it works as reliably as it does in Apple Calendar (I have 3 calendars) then it would really fix a lot of the annoyance I face when trying to use Pixel. This is actually a primary reason I can't give up my iPhone.

I looove this app a lot! From scheduling my to-do list up to my business stuff. I just don't know if this is an issue on my phone but sometimes when I will add a task, it will randomly have glitches. Like, when i select the 'All day' option, the 'task' will be converted as 'event' or when I click 'save', nothing happens.

This app mostly works well and made it easier for me track many things. Recently, a defect seems to have crept in. When trying to add guests to an account, this app is not able to find contacts based on name or nickname stored in the contacts. It's expecting exact emails to be entered even though it has permissions to access contacts and could add people by nicknames in the past.

There is no way to set a default view to open each time you launch the app - instead, it returns to whatever random view you were in when you closed the app. Also, you cannot use the phone's back buttons to return to the previous view/screen to exit back from day view into week/month view. Also, you cannot create a reoccurring event on the last day of the month. It has to be set to a date. With some months having 28-31 days, a single date is useless.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Hannah. The Last view you choose becomes your default view on the Google Calendar app. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: While recently searching for a past event, I realized that my calendar only shows events from 2019 to present. I document EVERYTHING in my calendar for a valid reason and to not be able to access it is frustrating. Overall, I am not entirely pleased anymore. UPDATE 25-Mar-2025: I had searched for an event and specific details. I've notice that only reoccurring events are saved, and anything prior to February 2024 has been deleted. I am livid because I cannot obtain or remember that information!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello there. We'd suggest you try the steps listed here, if you haven't already: https://goo.gle/37ZAO4p. In case the issue persists, please create a new thread on our Google Calendar Help Community for our experts to review: https://goo.gle/2QnxTMN. Thanks.

scraped_reviews.content: I miss the previous UI for time/dates. The ability to click and drag event times on the calendar itself was so efficient, and now it's gone. The new UI is so unintuitive, it's really off-putting. When changing the date on an event, the cursor automatically starts at the beginning of the date but doesn't overwrite when you start typing? You have to manually select the date if you want to type. Or click into a calendar view and pick a day. Please add an option to toggle between UIs.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there. You can drag and drop events in Day view, 3 Day view, and Week view. Also, you can submit your feedback directly with our product team here: https://goo.gle/37YOQmJ. Appreciate it.

scraped_reviews.content: Time zone support faulty. I can no longer trust my appointments. Scheduled events made during daylight saving time, have all been shifted an hour. I see "Pacific Daylight" on those, but changing the zone doesn't fix the problem. Selecting "Pacific Standard" results in "Alaska Daylight" showing - what the heck? Changing the time doesn't correct the graphic day representation. It's like there was no testing of this feature. Please reverse this change. It used to work fine.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Randy. You can learn more about time zone settings in the Calendar Help Center: https://goo.gle/2v9cyOZ. If you're still having trouble, you can find further help in the Google Calendar Help Community: https://goo.gle/2QnxTMN. Thanks!

scraped_reviews.content: I just attempted to make events for a yoga teacher training that went every other week, Friday, Sat & Sunday on my Pixel tablet. I made the first event on Friday, complete with the custom repeat. Then to save a few taps I duplicated the event, thinking I would not have to do the repeat again, it would still be repeating for 5 times like the first. I set the date to Saturday, changed the times and hit save. The first occurrence did not appear on the correct date! The reply isn't helpful. Bug!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi David. Have you tried the steps in this guide to create a recurring event: https://goo.gle/2vcKZUF? If that doesn't help, please visit the Google Calendar Help Community for our experts to review: https://goo.gle/2QnxTMN. Thanks.

scraped_reviews.content: After completing a meeting and confirming that it was recorded, I noticed that the recording does not appear in the calendar, even after waiting 24 hours. The only way I can make the recording attachments appear is by uninstalling and then reinstalling the application. Please look into this issue, as it is causing inconvenience when trying to access meeting recordings.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Saya! Could you give us some more information on the issue you are facing so that we may be of help? You can update your comment with a description of the issue. Have a great day!

scraped_reviews.content: Works but has usability flaws. Example: when you set location of a calendar event, it suggests locations Google knows about (or recently used?). That's fine when it comes up with the right location. But if their info is a bit off or incomplete, there's no way to edit their suggestion (in the event only). You can only accept their suggestion as is or enter all the info manually. Samsung's calendar app, on the other hand, lets you start from the suggested and edit to tailor it to your needs.

Nice, but suddenly doesn't work with having an Outlook calendar synced in the app anymore. The option for that in the settings is gone. Edit: the link from the developer just does the reverse, and just let's you view and edit your google calendar in another application.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Alicia. Have a look at this guide to sync your Calendar with computer programs: https://goo.gle/2H19IOE. For further help, please create a new thread in our Google Calendar Help Community for our experts to review: https://goo.gle/2QnxTMN. Thanks.

scraped_reviews.content: used to love this calendar app. now it's a joke., thankfully I realized it before I lost all the pertinent information, but it now only keeps 1year- after a year all events are lost, everything that isn't set to "repeat yearly" is gone!!! ridiculous! not giving me any help to get everything back. it's imperative for me to have a calendar that actually saves things to be able to go back and check things!!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Denise. We'll pass on your feedback to the team. Could you also submit it here: https://goo.gle/37YOQmJ? Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: I currently have multiple accounts on my calendar. The app keeps switching accounts to my other account, whenever I'm trying to create a new event/task. I didn't have this problem before. so I decided to rollback to an older version and problem is fixed. Dev needs to fix that bug on the new version of calendar. Update: problem has been fixed on the new version. thank you very much
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello there, Thanks for reporting this issue to us. We have identified and fixed the problem. We apologize for the inconveniences caused.

scraped_reviews.content: there's some calendar schedules that acted like ads, listing some activities of some games promotion! I had never added it before, and I deleted it keeps continue adding in my calendar. I had send feedback and nothing works. I don't like to have something weird in my calendar schedule, it would hide my other schedule on the time.

moved from iPhone so I'm missing some features from Apple Calendar... would like to see a view similar to Apple Calender where the top half of the screen displays the month, and bottom half shows the events for the day selected so you can see it all on one screen. it's the only thing keeping me with Apple Calendar. I don't feel like I can see enough of what I need so will continue to use Apple Calendar on web.

‚ö†Ô∏èUNDO THE LAST UPDATE!!! How could you release an update with so many issues?!?! Unable to add new appointments by tapping on the timeslot! What is happening here?!?!? Step 1: First, REVERSE that update, THEN figure out your issues. We can't stay in this version while you figure it out. Change it back today or switching to another app.

If you experience issues with the app, feel free to create a new thread in our Google Calendar Help Community for our experts to review: https://goo.gle/2QnxTMN. Thanks.

scraped_reviews.content: This is ridiculous; at this point in time for everyone having a Google account, there should be an option on Keep Notes, Calendar, etc to "Retrieve" all files from a Google account giving an annoying "full memory" banner, not have a user go through an ordeal to recover files after trying to get rid of a Google account. They are simply playing with the user to prevent them from deleting their accounts. Of course! they are forcing people to pay for memory storage, even when you can't pay for it.

Thanks for fixing the issue with adding ics-files to the calendar. Biggest issue is still that for whatever reason only my own birthday is shown in the calendar. I tried all options already, but still not working. The birthdays are synced to the Gmail account and the birthday check box in the calendar app is selected.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there. More info about the Birthdays feature can be found here: https://goo.gle/3SAx5EI. Thanks.

scraped_reviews.content: Need more color variety (maroon, brown, tan, chartreuse, mint) for events and tasks. There used to be more in the web version, but never the phone app for some reason. I love this app otherwise, it's very useful and has become pretty important to my everyday organization.

updating my review I do that every year, the functionality of this app continues to deteriorate and they are doing absolutely nothing about it. you will set an appointment on a date and time and go back to find it on another date and time. you can reschedule an appointment and it will go back to the original appointment time as soon as you turn your back on it. A calendar app that can't keep track of appointments is useless and an embarrassment.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Justin. Please visit our Calendar Help Community for more help: https://goo.gle/2QnxTMN. Thanks!

scraped_reviews.content: On the whole, a simple and effective App ... BUT, there is no drop-down arrow or other means of expanding Search terms. I only ever wish to search for future entries, yet I always get results going back several years.

When tapping the current date in Schedule view, the calendar cuts off the items for that day. Choosing any other day shows all of the items for that day. Security issue for over two years now: When viewing an event from a notification, it just overlays on top of whatever app you were on. scraped_reviews.content: Best calendar to use if you have multiple projects, tasks, and people you have to manage....including your family!! I have different calenders within the main calendar but they are all visible on one. And each one is color coded based on the category or person. For example, I have separate calendars for personal, business, physical health, self-care, and one for each of my kids (sports & school). The colors help me quickly see what or who I have scheduled on any given day. Love it!!

I use this calendar to keep track of coworkers schedules. However every time we hire a new employee I have to get an invitation sent to me for this calendar. Refreshing the calendar does not update it to show new employees. It's too cumbersome, but this is the one we use at work.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Teresa. We'd suggest you try the steps listed here, if you haven't already: https://goo.gle/37ZAO4p. In case the issue persists, please create a new thread on our Google Calendar Help Community for our experts to review: https://goo.gle/2QnxTMN. Thanks.

scraped_reviews.content: It frustrates me that on mobile the app hides the guest list when it gets to a certain number (only 50 or so). I can't hop in to see who's confirmed going even if it's a small number relative to the number of invites.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there. Thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it.

scraped_reviews.content: I'm just trying to keep track of birthdays including year of birth. that simple task is proving to be impossible. In case the issue persists, please create a new thread on our Google Calendar Help Community for our experts to review: goo.gle/2QnxTMN. Thanks.

scraped_reviews.content: You can pinch to zoom and tap and drag but it's hard to do when the tasks can only be a small box you can't increase the time on, it wants a lot of data but if you have a non24 Hour circadian rhythm disorder and you're almost always awake past midnight then tasks is essential. Not keen on data collection but Proton calendar was not non24 compatible. Can't set notifications for only certain tasks unfortunately.No fully offline mode.Deleted tasks in Google Calendar cannot be restored in the app
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: Generally good, some nice to haves would be theme settings like cute, colourful, neutral etc, and more options like include moon phases, also if the calendar when opened could be changed from list format to the standard full month view. without being the full screen that would be better

I use my google calendar for everything, especially since I have a lot of medical appointments, and it has made my life easier. I also love the fact that you can set up alarms and reminders for anything, set up video appointments, invite specific people you choose to participate in appointments, or any other thing you choose to be involved in any other thing, and keep everything else on your calendar private. Thanks Google for yet another great app/program!

I like that everyone in the family can have access to the calendar and it is printable, but seriously Google I need way more colors. I also do not want to create a calendar for every color I need. Please please please like triple the amount of usable colors. I have 4 people that each need their own color palette. Also, I want to be able to rename all of the calendars not just 1 or 2. Additionally, I want all notifications but the family does not.

scraped_reviews.content: so couple weeks ago my significant other appointments started popping up on my calendar we don't have family connection with anything with calendar. now I'm getting emails of events invites from Biden invitees that show nothing in on calendar. an no option to view or see anything about it an all the birthdays I had in calendar for some over 15yrs to a decade cause haven't added any most in almost decade are all gone as well idk what is being changed with the app but it's destroying it
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Chad. Could you give us some more information on the issue you are facing so that we may be of help? You can update your comment with a description of the issue. Have a great day.

scraped_reviews.content: deleted multiple events I had booked for this month including two separate hospital appointments. can no longer trust or rely upon one of the most core and basic apps / tasks of a smart phone. normally a massive Google and Android fan but very disappointed and frustrated by this issue! and no I didn't accidentally delete 8 separate events or mix calendars / users etc...
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Robert. Try looking through your trash for the missing events (see "See deleted events in your trash" section): https://goo.gle/2p1DQn2. scraped_reviews.content: I switched from Samsung calendar and, for my purposes, they're functionally equivalent. However, there's one thing that bothers me about the Google calendar: it doesn't show the date on the icon face. For example the Samsung calendar shows Mon/13 for today. I used to glance at it all the time when needed. It's a little thing but it bothers me enough I'm considering switching back.

Since the update it's been a bit cumbersome to reschedule an event. Previously, I could tap edit, select the date and the calendar would zoom out so I can select the dates with visual context. With the new version, I must tap the calendar icon again for it to zoom out. Very versatile calendar. Developers, please allow changing event duration by dragging the edges of the event box on the mobile app.

Pretty simple and effective! Love that you can set reminders to repeat at basically any interval you want, that events have different colours, and that it's easy to drag them around if you need. Great functionality for a free tool. Issues: you can't set a task to repeat if it has subtasks. You can't set the length of time a task will take, only when it will start. And you can't set tasks to different colours.

I use the Google Calendar app a lot and after the recent update, when creating a calendar entry, it automatically switches to another Google account on my phone and I have to check every time to ensure that the entry is created under the correct account. This didn't happen before the newrst update. As a heavy user, I appreciate it the Google team can take this issue seriously and fix the problem ASAP so we can continue to enjoy the app. Thanks!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, thanks for reporting. We'd suggest you try the steps listed here, if you haven't already: https://goo.gle/37ZAO4p. In case the issue persists, please create a new thread on our Google Calendar Help Community for our experts to review: https://goo.gle/2QnxTMN. Thanks.

scraped_reviews.content: Automatically dismisses events that I have not processed yet. This causes me to miss things because I no longer see them as notifications on my phone. And it causes the connection to my Thunderbird calendar to think it's dismissed also. I can't live with that. Calendar events are important notifications on my phone for doctor appts, boss meetings, birthdays, and everything else.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello there. Have a look at the steps in this guide to troubleshoot Calendar notifications: https://goo.gle/2H0Ag2o. In case the issue persists, please create a new thread on our Google Calendar Help Community for our experts to review: https://goo.gle/2QnxTMN. Thanks.

scraped_reviews.content: I don't know why, but there seems to have been an update around the start of September 2025 that has ruined the functionality of this app. It used to allow me to continue to use the sub calendar I was in last, now it defaults to one that I have never used on one of the extra accounts. So instead of just making events, I have to change which Google account I'm on then select the sub calendar for it. The only part that isn't broken is that it lets me see all the events of my synched calendars.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Thatcher, Thanks for reporting this issue to us. We have identified and fixed the problem. We apologize for the inconveniences caused.

scraped_reviews.content: It stopped showing months. Very confusing. I don't see an option to include a screenshot so I'll try to describe the issue. The month used to appear to the right of the hamburger menu. It no longer displays. When you're trying to add appointments this makes the calendar very confusing. Please note I have been using this calendar for many years and this seems to have started after the last update (which also wrecked voicemail).
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Amanda! Could you give us some more information on the issue you are facing so that we may be of help? You can update your comment with a description of the issue. Have a great day!

scraped_reviews.content: my calendar has updated and all of my appointments, past and present, have been cleared! it is synced with a Microsoft email. The same calendar app is still working on another device that has not updated itself. Very concerned üòü nothing in your links help. I've already gone through everything several times before coming in here. Again, another device that has not received the update, is working fine. It's my work phone that updated last night and stopped syncing with my Microsoft account üòû
