summary: Try it FREE! Watch live TV from 100+ channels including news, sports, and shows.

scraped_reviews.content: This app has a lot of issues. First and foremost they raised their prices to $82.99/month, so why am I still getting ads (on recorded shows/movies); and not even channel ads but YouTube sponsor ship ads?! Second, when you pause in the middle of show/movie and come back to it later, you get a black screen (sometimes audio) and you have to exit and re-enter several times, just to continue watching the content. Also, why are there a lack of extra channels for that price? Dish packages are cheaper.

absolute terrible experience. do not sign up for this service! they have no interest in anything but your money. they won't fight for you with the TV services all they are fighting for is more money! 20 channels gone and they're still charging the same price. and if you want a credit you have to jump through 27 hoops to get it and then there's no guarantee that it will actually be applied to your account in time for the next bill. sign up for any service except this one!!!!!

The user interface is poor. There are no channel numbers so if you want to jump to a particular channel, you have to scroll down or up to get to it. Lots of games on Sunday Ticket as have been mentioned are blocked for being in market when they are hundreds of miles away. Very frustrating for the money spent on it. Over all if the product was better I could maybe justify the price, but in it's current state there is no way. Prices need to be cut in half for what they are offering. 2.5/5 stars.

This used to be a great app when I wasn't traveling. Now that I often travel, it doesn't allow me to select that I'm traveling and therefore restricts me from watching shows in the city where I'm located. It makes it difficult to see local news and traffic conditions. Bottom line, no longer worth the subscription.

I would have given 5 stars, but for several long-standing bugs that block me from a couple of features that are very important to me. For the last several years, I have benn unable to display the list of my recordings in the library. When I choose the library tab, most of the time the wait cursor appears for several minutes, then I see the error message "Oops, something went wrong" and none of my recordings are displayed. Also, under the Home tab, I no longer see "Resume Watching".

App works, its just entirely way to expensive. Also, the free trial they offered at the time I signed up was 2 weeks and $14.99 for the first month. When I went to manage subscription, it showed only 3 days left for free trial and would be charged $64.99 for the first month instead of the original promotional price. I cancelled imediately. I feel that is false advertising. Good thing i noticed it before i got charged. Check your membership before you get charged incorrect amount guys.

Whenever I am trying to watch a basketball game that is either delayed or recorded, I am suddenly taken to the beginning of the recording. It's happening incessantly now. I can't even get 2 min of gameplay in before it is jumping to the beginning. So frustrating. Especially during March Madness. You continue to up and up your price, placing a premium on your service, but cannot do the simple things like video quality and playback right. SMH

I've had no issues for, I think it's been a few years, when the price went up there was a bug with my billing and my YTTV account. So my billing was paid, but it wasn't recognized by my account and my account keeps asking me to sign up. It's been 18 days and counting since my YTTV has been inaccessible and they kept my money. All customer service tells me is that it's been "escalated to our engineers." I've asked them for a refund and I get no answer. And I'm at max characters for this review.

Everything I've tried to watch, the wording is off by like a whole second. And when you pause it to fix it, it works, then pause itself and goes back to being off by a second. It's super fn annoying especially for something I'm paying for? Yeah right, never ever again n that's the reason I'll never do it again. Waste of money and time. Not to mention the content is old AF. It's almost as bad as Netflix.

The developers of this app simply cannot get it together. I constantly have to reopen the mobile app since it keeps disappearing from the top. Once opened, it no longer is in synch with the show that is on TV. The show is at a different place. If a recorded movie gets restarted it will be at a different spot that where you left off. Would recommend others purchase another service that is reliable, if available. It is time to search for other options or just enjoy Showbox and Netflix. Those are fantastic apps.

The unlimited recording is a great feature. The rewind/forward controls should be placed below or above the controls for skip forward/back. I keep hitting the wrong one. Also, when you pause, the screen dims to about half and the virtual controls remain plastered across the screen. Not good if you want to see a detail in the paused image. Overall, ok.

Well, there was definitely things I liked. But suddenly after 4 days of the trial the channel won't load no matter how many apps/channels i delete from my Roku. I would not recommend this at all if you use a Roku device. Sad, because it has a good premise. Being able to rearrange and edit what channels show up and the order of them. But if it won't load, its pointless.

Just meh. I pay $72 a month for youtube tv and it was only supposed to be $60, is my 1st issue. Secondly, for $72 a month all the shows I have recorded has 10 commercials per 30 min-60 min shows that you can not fast forward through. To me that's absolutely ridiculous considering I only pay $19 for netflix WITHOUT commercials! For me I haven't experienced any "playback errors" as others have. I think for the price a whole lot of updating and fixing issues need to be made to justify the cost!

I like the concept that YouTube has here and for the price it's great but there is still a lot to update and make better. First thing is the amount of channels is ok not at the amount of some other apps but the price is cheaper. Second thing is the sound quality is horrible. I'll be watching a on demand show and the show it's self is really hard to hear unless you turn it up a lot to when they have their add commercials come on the sound is crazy loud to almost blowing out my speakers. I don't have a cheap sound system and I don't have just a sound bar so I know it's not my equipment because this doesn't happen anywhere else. YouTube please fix this issue. Last thing is that there needs to be a already watched this episode option. I have a bunch of shows in my library that say 2 or 3 episode that are unwatched but when I go in it is already something I have seen it just didn't mark it off. This is a little annoying and makes you think you have missed something. The live TV is great but does take a while to load sometimes but the quality I think is better than cable. I will keep using this but I hope it gets better.

Great price and a huge viewing selection and options to choose from but what good is it if you can never watch anything all the way through, Live or Recorded, due to continuous freezing, buffering or no connection at all and I can't spend another month with the"Oops something went wrong" message!! Unfortunately, I MUST go back to Direct TV. The price is higher than I would like but YouTube proves that you get what you pay for.

Pretty buggy. Too hard to browse live TV. In app, I can only see what's currently live, but not what's starting in 15 minutes for example. If there's a program that starts in the future, and I just want to go to that channel, there aren't options to do so from the program page. Broadcasting to my TV, or more specifically changing programs while broadcasting from my phone is buggy. Detinitely not as good as the normal YT app, very expensive, interface could be better, but gets the job done.

If you're looking to pay $75 a month to spend 50% of your time watching commercials, this is for you! Paused the show for 30 seconds? Welcome back! Here's 2.5 minutes of ads. Go ahead and watch the episode for another minute and then we'll show you another 3 minutes of ads! This is nothing but a money hungry, glitchy app and Im confident the developers got their degree from a cracker jack box. We're dropping YouTube tv for good after this month. Don't waste your money.

Rates going up! in general, for $40/month, I was willing to subscribe. But I was just informed my rates are going up by $10 each month. It no longer has the same appeal at $50/month. Combination of local channels and sports was great. Unlimited cloud DVR was a plus, but many shows won't allow you to skip commercials. At $50 a month, I'll be looking for another option.

Difficult to navigate. Buttons are too close together, I went to press rewind 15sec but accidentally pressed start over instead because buttons are too close. Difficult to set DVR. DVR for sports is unreliable, it would skip games frequently. If there's an English version and Spanish version of the game going on at the same time, it would record the Spanish version. There's no way to change that and I don't speak Spanish. Also DVR won't let you set time extension for sports events in case of over time. Difficult to figure out shows line up for the next day. Overall very difficult and frustrating to use.

Overall, I'm a huge fan of YouTube TV. It was better when they showed how much as time was left so you could go take a leak if you wanted. Saves a ton over DirecTV and we don't miss a show. Would be nice too get NickJR someday. Update, they are starting to fall behind a bit. not enough NFL, blackout of some games, and the quality is low on Apple TV. still good, but better options are creeping in.

After 1.5 years, there's STILL no decent way to see a list of what's coming on TV after what's on right now. The list in the app shows what's on right now, but if it's, let's say 4:50pm and you want to see what's on at 5pm, well... You better be willing to either use a computer to see what's coming up, or use the app and carefully check each network one at a time... It's ridiculous, not a big deal at first but over time, it becomes increasingly more annoying! PLEASE FIX IT!!!!

limited access on increasing number of programs. On-demand streaming commercials are almost double the decibels of the program. Furthermore, they're increasing prices. Probably will leave soon. The app periodically crashes too, which is infuriating because it takes so much time to launch and watch 2 minutes of commercials in order to resume. F*** you Google. you used to be good.

Just okay. Biggest issue is it's a pain to watch your recorded shows. You navigate horizontally and the oldest episode is all the way to the right. You have to move all the way over to start watching at the last recorded episode. Plus it sometimes mixes in live shows. Other issue is there are no profiles... ?? Your whole household's viewing history is combined. Really waters down the recommendations because they are based on everyone. Great in terms of the quantity of content.

*edit* the stuff below was from a year and a half ago, and NOTHING has changed. Every time you turn around theyre dropping channels and sending you an email about how they're charging you more for less. It's a scam at this point. Flat out. They keep raising prices and dropping channels. There's a button to "submit feedback" but it literally doesn't do anything when you click it. I've had YouTube tv for a few years now and it has gotten worse and worse while the price has gone up and up

The app does not work on my device, which is a Galaxy Fold. It doesn't work folded or open. The sound will play but the video is black. If I close & reopen the app multiple times the video will sometimes work for a little bit but then stop. It works great on all of my other devices & I have used YTTV for years. It's been this way for at least a year. I always keep the app updated.

Trash app with chromecast. 15 sec FF/rewind doesn't work. Go to a channel, it'll bring up a show from a random time slot. The wrong time slot show issue, it'll crash the app if you l try to reload the show. I've turned off my phone, it won't stop playing. Watch a show for an hour, or pause for awhile, if you reload the app you will literally have the show playing on your TV, and the app playing on a different time frame, you have to uncast, and recast, and you can't go back to where it was.

I lüíóve YouTube TV!! I did the trial period in the middle of the month to see if I liked it better than Sling TV. You have to pay more on Sling to get a finite amount of program storage. By the time I add features I want, they're the same price. And I was able to pause my account, so when I'm ready to go back everything I saved will still be there. My only issue is that I feel you should get YouTube Premium included with the subscription. Or at least get a discount when you have both.

If YouTube TV is no longer available on Roku, I will cancel the subscription that I've had for quite some time. It's a lot easier to change the app than the platform. The email that I received, suggesting that I just stream from my phone, is rediculous. Either the app works or it doesn't. If it doesn't work, it will be removed and replaced with an app that does.

YouTube TV used to be great. Now you are forced to watch commercials on shows you have recorded, in addition to the regular commercials that you can still fastforward through! It's very frustrating, especially when some of the "commercials" are annoying music playing over a basic background with the name of the channel. Also, they need to fix the "pause" feature, because many times you pause because there is something on the screen you want to see and they block too much of the screen.

I would give this app negative stars if I could! You pay for content that you can't even watch because the app is almost never working. After adding shows to your library and pre-recording the episodes, you'll get constant "playback errors" every time you try to play it. Then it'll ask you to send an email to their support which will lead nowhere. Other shows will be listed as "not in your area" even if they play just fine on your television. This app is less than worthless.

App is easy to navigate. Still needs a few more options with the DVR features, like record only new episodes. But all in all much easier to use than the "other" guys. My service was out for an hour and two days later I get an email from YouTube TV apologizing for the interruption and gives me one free week of service!! The cable guys would never give me free anytime much less being proactive about it like YouTube TV was. Very impressed with that level of service, definitely make me feel like I made the right decision cutting the cord!

4.14 update: uninstalled due to commercials. Costs too much. Channel selection is good and keeps getting better, but that isn't a selling point for me. The only reason I still use YouTube TV is for live sports. I wish you could just pay for a sports package. The library feature is nice. I like the sorting feature, and adding/ recording shows is easy. Plus you can watch on any device.

I had youtube tv for a long time and have accepted the price increases. However, as of recent I am very disappointed with the service! During mobile streaming sreen eventually goes black. I have to go to another channel, let it play for a few seconds, then go back to the channel I was watching to get it to play. Never had this issue before! Very frustrating and happens ALL THE TIME. In addition it buffers all the time on my TV too. Please fix. This is too expensive to be having this experience!

I Love YouTube but I miss the way it used to be where it was easy to find what you were looking for! It's such a annoying process to find anything that might relate to the subject being searched for! I wish I could just find what I'm wanting to watch quicker and easier but instead, now I have to watch so many ads just to view a video that may only be 2 mins long, most of the time, recently, the ads are longer than the videos I'm viewing! That's Crazy!

Slowww or Doesn't Load. It takes forever for recorded movies to load, if they even load at all. As I right this, it's just swirling and swirling and not loading. I have tried 3 different movies in the past 15 minutes. Recorded TV shows is not a problem. Very clear picture. The channel guide is confusing and you can't switch back to the last show. And I do have high speed internet.

The service itself is good, but the Android app fails to do the most basic things reliably. It often plays a totally different show when you select one. Or it will play the right one, but change as soon as you cast it. Lately, it's started to play from the beginning when you select "join live." Just constantly buggy and frustrating to use.

Update: The price hike yet again is very frustrating. You lose 1 star. Old review: Really can't beat the price and user interface, as well as the ability to play on all my devices. They have practically all the sport channels you're going to need, and they're now in 60fps. The unlimited cloud DVR is a huge selling point. Just missing a few channels.

At first, everything was great, but recently, there have been problems with live streaming. The audio and visual are not syncing, and it seems like every show is lagging and skipping while I'm trying to watch. I know it's not my system because my other streaming platforms are not doing this. Plus, I watched several movies on the premium networks that I purchased with my plan and they stream fine. I am at the point of wanting to get a refund, rebate, or discounted service for the inconveniences.

Don't even try the free trial. The app is so buggy I don't have enough characters to describe it, won't connect to Chromecast at all, there's close to a dozen ads per movie (I'm not kidding, The Equalizer has ten and they're two minutes each), and the layout is awful in my opinion. Almost like they don't want you to find things, but that's just me. All this for $60+ a month? AND you have to pay for additional channels? Absolutely not. YouTube as a platform is just so greedy.

I don't pay for the service with the convenience of the app, when the app is largely non-functional. Constantly get error messages while trying to watch live anything, after about 30 seconds to a minute of steaming. Fix your app, or you may lose a customer soon. No excuse for the same playback errors plaguing this thing for over a year, and despite all the updates to it in that span, it still does the same darned thing.

So many great movies on here to watch, only issue is that they are all coming soon. 50-75% of the titles are coming soon and you can't watch them. Total not worth the amount of money required for even the cheapest subscription. Half of what you can watch you can find on other streaming apps that with all their subscriptions added up don't touch the cost of this one

The service is solid. There is no guide to see upcoming programming at all. There is no way to filter only recorded shows. You have to shuffle through upcoming recorded shows and recorded shows in the the same view. App doesn't synchronize with Chromecast consistently and when it does, it constantly loses its connection. Approaching a year since my original review and although the application is regularly updated, still experiencing same issues with different Android devices.

I love YouTube TV . I enjoy watching local stations and having a library of stuff that records for me so I can watch my shows whenever I have time. and being able to watch things in real time. However the price is to HIGH!! I will not be able to keep it past my 3 month special price. Unless the lower the price i will be forced to unsubscibe come the end of July üò™

I actually enjoy this app, it works with zero issues for me. That said, it needs a massive update as far as the interface and is concerned, navigating feels more tedious than it should be. Pricing is becoming an issue. I wish we could buy packages of all the stuff we actually watch instead of paying for channels we never watch. Good service still but is it that much better than cable at this point/price? Yes but just barely. If the price rises any higher, idk if I'll keep it much longer.

Recently, it's glitching to a black screen where I have to turn my phone off and back on for it to fix. And now the pause button and fast forward and rewind buttons are just gone.. They don't show up on the screen anymore. If I touch in the places they used to be, they'll sometimes work, but nothing is viable. The progress bar is gone too. It's making it very hard to watch on my phone like I used to.

I didn't like it very much. Sure, the channel selection was good. The thing was it constantly crashed on my Roku TV to the point where I couldn't even watch on my TV anymore. I also didn't like that guide didn't advance automatically. I had to close the app to get the guide to advance to the next time slot. Then I could move it one more only. It's very inconvenient and restrictive. YouTube TV is not worth what they charge!

I got the free trial offer and the range of channels was pretty good. It would have been more helpful to not try and sneak in non-free movies and channels but the choices were good overall. Now to the bad one-star rating... Ads. Paying more than basic cable for sometimes 20 ads in an hour show is ABSURD. It got to a point where I was so angry and nervous about being bombarded with ads I had to turn off the tv and walk away. This is a terrible experience if you simply just wanting to watch a nice show and chill with family. Never again, especially for the price. It's double dipping and ripping us off charging so much for the service and then getting ad revenue! Bad business practice Google. Do better.

I prefer the format of youtube tv but I want to warn people about a costly con to it. Whatever you do, use a payment source without overdraft fees. If you miss a payment they continue trying until they get it or you close that source. (No limit on times tried) Once "they" pause your account, you can't manually pause or cancel it. If you have a bank with overdraft fees, this could quickly become a very costly oversight at 35 a pop. I also have an area issue.

Overall I like it but it has its issues. The problems I've encountered are lag time in some of the streaming, which seems to affect some stations more than others--hiccups, and some casting issues--this happens very often. I'm assuming this is because I have an older Chromecast. I tried rebooting but that didn't help. Customer service was helpful. But it seems to be a pretty good value compared with cable. I haven't used other streaming services so I don't have anything but cable to compare it with.

The app performs well on my phone and laptop, but recently on my Roku TV, there have been lots of issues. Every time we try to fast forward through commercials on recorded shows, the spinning wheel of death just sits there for minutes before continuing to play the show. It goes on for so long that you might as well just let the commercials play through. Same thing happens when switching shows on the live feature. This has been very frustrating. Please fix the bugs.

title: TomTom GO Expert: Truck GPS
description:
TomTom's trusted truck navigation. Now on your mobile.

Join a million drivers and enjoy the most reliable sat nav app for trucks: TomTom GO Expert. Smooth deliveries from start to finish with custom truck navigation, traffic info, multi-drop planning & relevant POIs. Decades of TomTom expertise in one app. TOMTOM GO Expert: ESCAPE TRAFFIC, SAVE TIME & SAVE MONEY üñ§ üöö Enter your vehicle's dimensions to get personalised guidance ‚õΩ Find gas stations to fill up your specific fuel type üì¶ Enter your dangerous cargo information to avoid certain roads üÖøÔ∏è Easily find truck rest-stops üèÅ Define your desired maximum speed and get an adjusted ETA ‚ú® Steer clear of traffic and blocked roads in REAL-TIME üëÆ‚ÄçÔ∏è Drive hassle-free with SPEED ALERTS and warnings for fixed and mobile speed cameras üì± Compatible with ANDROID AUTO ‚Äì Get directions and real-time info on a bigger screen and in surround sound ‚õΩ Find the cheapest fuel along your route with live information about FUEL PRICES üìµ NO ADS, no distractions, and data PRIVACY at its best. See only what is important on the road ‚§¥Ô∏è Know exactly which lane to take with LANE GUIDANCE, never miss a turn with easy turn-by-turn directions üÖøÔ∏è TomTom ROUTEBAR always shows you all relevant warnings and notifications along your route üöô Smarter journeys for both cars and trucks, enter your vehicle's dimensions to get personalised guidance üîã Save your mobile data and battery using OFFLINE MAPS, while driving with up-to-date GPS navigation Are you one of the happy TomTom GO Expert app users? Please leave a review and spread the word. Thank you for your support üòä ¬∑ Android Auto is a trademark of Google LLC ¬∑ Use of this sat nav app is subject to the terms and conditions at tomtom.com/en_us/legal/ ¬∑ Speed camera alerts may only be used in accordance with the laws and regulations of the country in which you are driving. In some countries, these functions are prohibited by law. You can turn speed camera alerts on and off in TomTom GO Expert. For more information go to: tomtom.com/en_us/navigation/mobile-apps/go-navigation-app/disclaimer/
descriptionHTML:
TomTom's trusted truck navigation. Now on your mobile.



Join a million drivers and enjoy the most reliable sat nav app for trucks: TomTom GO Expert. Smooth deliveries from start to finish with custom truck navigation, traffic info, multi-drop planning & relevant POIs. Decades of TomTom expertise in one app.

TOMTOM GO Expert: ESCAPE TRAFFIC, SAVE TIME & SAVE MONEY üñ§
üöö Enter your vehicle's dimensions to get personalised guidance
‚õΩ Find gas stations to fill up your specific fuel type
üì¶ Enter your dangerous cargo information to avoid certain roads
üÖøÔ∏è Easily find truck rest-stops
üèÅ Define your desired maximum speed and get an adjusted ETA
‚ú® Steer clear of traffic and blocked roads in REAL-TIME
üëÆ‚ÄçÔ∏è Drive hassle-free with SPEED ALERTS and warnings for fixed and mobile speed cameras
üì± Compatible with ANDROID AUTO ‚Äì Get directions and real-time info on a bigger screen and in surround sound
‚õΩ Find the cheapest fuel along your route with live information about FUEL PRICES
üìµ NO ADS, no distractions, and data PRIVACY at its best. See only what is important on the road
‚§¥Ô∏è Know exactly which lane to take with LANE GUIDANCE, never miss a turn with easy turn-by-turn directions
üÖøÔ∏è TomTom ROUTEBAR always shows you all relevant warnings and notifications along your route
üöô Smarter journeys for both cars and trucks, enter your vehicle's dimensions to get personalised guidance
üîã Save your mobile data and battery using OFFLINE MAPS, while driving with up-to-date GPS navigation

Are you one of the happy TomTom GO Expert app users? Please leave a review and spread the word. Thank you for your support üòä

¬∑ Android Auto is a trademark of Google LLC
¬∑ Use of this sat nav app is subject to the terms and conditions at tomtom.com/en_us/legal/
¬∑ Speed camera alerts may only be used in accordance with the laws and regulations of the country in which you are driving. In some countries, these functions are prohibited by law. You can turn speed camera alerts on and off in TomTom GO Expert. For more information go to: tomtom.com/en_us/navigation/mobile-apps/go-navigation-app/disclaimer/
summary: Get routes that fit your truck, traffic info, multi-drop planning, truck POIs...

scraped_reviews.content: TomTom is definitely going down in terms of quality. I pay a subscription for the app for using with a truck and often find areas where the speed limits or weight limits are wrong. TomTom seem more interested in partnering with vehicle manufacturers than improving this service (I have 3x reports that I requested in June 2025!). Considering there is a free alternative in the form of Eurowag Navi, unless there are some improvements then I'll cancel my subscription. On the upside, the UI is nice.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello there, We're sorry to hear about your concerns regarding the accuracy of speed and weight limits in the app. We understand your frustration with the delay in response to your reports. Your feedback is valuable, and we will share it with our development team for improvement. Thank you for your support! ^Rahyl

scraped_reviews.content: After using this only 3 times, I was sold. Paid for the year. For the first time I have a Navigation app that works near perfect. The settings are great, good customization, good UI, nice features, but the most important thing is that the navigation is flawless. The only nav app that DOESN'T give me anxiety when using it. No worrying that I can't figure out where I'm getting off for the next exit, no ridiculous maneuvers, no trying to figure anything out. Just getting where I need to go easy. üôÇ
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Antonio, we're thrilled to hear that you're enjoying our app! Our goal is to provide a seamless navigation experience with all the essential features. Thank you for the great feedback! ^Jas

scraped_reviews.content: It might get you there. Downloaded and installed this trying to get away from the Google option. They give you a whole week (woohoo) to try it out before paying for it. There were a couple of glitches that I just couldn't see paying for. In Android Auto, twice the display just stopped moving while driving in an area I've never been. Had to go back to Maps to get where I was going. AA always starts with North up. Would prefer to have the option to change that. And the cartoonishly large arrow??
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello there, Sorry to hear about the experience- we have shared your feedback internally with the team and will ensure to improve our services. Thanks for bringing this to our attention. Thanks' ^Rahyl

scraped_reviews.content: I used it for a while and decided to try it again. I had to purchase it because I'm not eligible for the free trial again. Ot required me to download a map, which took a long time. It now shows a blue arrow (presumably where I am) against a totally blank background. I just wasted $5. Edit... finally got the map to load but it can't find a destination 7 hours away. Ugh

Update: I managed to test this product for almost a week. It works great if you enter street addresses. Routing works on point. I really like how I can find gas stations on route. Businesses like restaurants, bowling, etc, that have existed for years are not in the database. This limits it's day to day use. I can justify spending a small one time fee and live with this limitation, but not a subscription.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Anony, we sincerely regret for the unintended grievance caused. Our concerned team is actively working to improve our POI database. Please stay tuned! ^Harry

scraped_reviews.content: For people having problems loading the app like myself I finally figured it out! Go into settings and then go to apps. Click on the go app. Click storage. Then you want to clear the cache and then clear data. restart your phone or tablet. I did not have to reinstall the go app from the Play Store. Good luck this is what worked for me .
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Ron - We are glad to know that app is working fine for you. We hope you continue to enjoy using the app. If you have any questions about using it, don't hesitate in letting us know. Cheers, and happy motoring! ‚Ä¢ TomTom Team

scraped_reviews.content: Price for subscription is too high. I was an early adopter and had used this app years ago, at the time Google maps weren't nearly as good and phone data was more expensive and coverage worse, so it made sense to have a standalone navigation app. nowadays, the cost for data, data coverage and gmaps are much much better, that's why I think for me, I would be willing to pay $10 per year for the otherwise great TomTom interface, but not more.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Sorry to hear that you think the price is too high!

The cost includes lifetime offline maps, live traffic, speed cameras and mydrive support. We think it's worth the fee!

- Cameron at TomTom

scraped_reviews.content: Using TomTom to navigate to an unknown Point of Interest (POI) has been a long-standing issue, but it was easily resolved by manually adding the POIs. Over the years, I have created a personalized library, and it was always possible to import .ov2 files into the TomTom app. However, in this new version, this simple operation is no longer possible, rendering my files useless. In conclusion, the app has become useless and expensive. I recommend using WAZE, which is free and user-friendly.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello there, Thanks for bringing this to our attention! We rely on input such as this to make us aware of things that can be done better. We appreciate your feedback. ^Rahyl

scraped_reviews.content: Would love to rate it 5 stars. Absolutely love the look and UI of the app. The maps look great. But I had to go back to Copilot. There are too many stretches of Interstate that it thinks are still closed due to construction. So it tries to route you way out of route. Also there are several secondary roads that it thinks have a 4 ton weight limit that have no signs stating that. As a truck driver I can not afford to have it routing me way out of route. Especially for $19 a month.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Jeromy, Thanks for bringing this to our attention! We rely on input such as this to make us aware of things that can be done better. We appreciate your feedback. ^Rahyl

scraped_reviews.content: I had big hopes for this app because it worked with Android Auto. The posted speed is wrong on the app for many roads I travel. For example, if the posted speed is 35, the app shows it as 20. Then, when the posted speed changes to 45, the app shows 30 and takes too long to update. Because of this, I had to turn off the audio speed warning. Also, at different places in my daily travels, the app will drop. My Android Auto will show that it is connected, but the app has lost connection.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello there, Sorry to hear that - We need some additional information (exact location) to investigate it further. Please help us reporting it here https://www.tomtom.com/mapshare/tools/new/mapshare/. Thanks' ^Rahyl

scraped_reviews.content: This is the best of the GPS navigation apps I found for the Android system so far. It shows good maps, and tracks quite well. Has some idiosyncrasies that are annoying, however. For example, in many Urban settings it only tells you every other or every third cross street. When you're simply looking for a certain turn or intersection this can be an extremely annoying omission. We were a little annoyed with the route planning algorithms when trying to drive through Portland Oregon recently. No matter whether we chose the shortest route, or the fastest route, it seems we got either a bunch of turn offs that were unnecessary, or it dragged us off the interstate onto a bunch of side streets just to make sure we were going the shortest distance. It needs to have some option for, perhaps, the simplest route. When you're pulling a trailer you don't want to be exiting and entering a freeway repeatedly, or driving around on a bunch of tiny surface streets. Lastly, I would really like to see an option for displaying your elevation as you're traveling. That's another handy feature when you're dragging a trailer up a long grade. It can be helpful to know how close to the summit you actually are.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Ken, thanks for this thorough and insightful review of the app!

It's so nice to hear that you enjoy using it. I will certainly feed back your comments to our development team.

For now, happy motoring!

- Cameron at TomTom

scraped_reviews.content: The app is nice. I seem to be accurate. The is a few annoying thing. There should be an option to save the map to the external memory card. it takes to much memory. Seems to somethings pick the nears intersection, when saving a location. Points of interest is basicly useless. I dont understand, where they come from. I took me on a toll road, even though I had the option set to not do that. It would be nice, if miles would be expressed in decimal 10th miles, instead of fractions.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Sean. It is possible to install a map to an external SD card. If you are having trouble with this, please contact support:

www.tomtom.com/368

They can also help with the routing issues you've mentioned. I have fed back your comments about the way distance is displayed, thanks for your idea.

- Cameron at TomTom

scraped_reviews.content: Overall good, but I have a couple of small issues. The map zoom is weird. It stays really close. You can zoom out and it will stay, but when it zooms in for a turn, it barely zooms back out afterwards, so you only see about a mile ahead. It also does strange routing sometimes. Like trying to go around the perimeter of my neighborhood instead of the faster, direct route straight through. It should also give better alerts when map updates are available.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Jeremy, Thanks for bringing this to our attention! We rely on input such as this to make us aware of things that can be done better. We appreciate your feedback. ^Rahyl

scraped_reviews.content: Being a part time courier I need a good navigation app, I was hoping this would be the app, as the price is very reasonable. Unfortunately I cannot even get it to run on my phone, Galaxy S8, it appears that any map you download won't work. I can't add any places or search for anything, just get 'internal search error' message, have reinstalled several times to no avail. Very disappointed.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Chris, this is something that is not good to hear. Fret not, we are here to assist you. We're unable to access the account details via Review, hence provide us with some additional details here: https://bit.ly/2MOGIQt. Thanks! ^Fiona

scraped_reviews.content: Have three big issues after installing. I predominantly use Android auto. 1st issue, and this is a deal breaker, I can't figure out how to display the current street I'm on w/out a destination programmed. This is a must have feature. 2nd. Font is too small, need to make bigger. Can't see without my readers. 3rd. I need to turn off the speed nany. Update: That setting is enabled. Still no street name. Also I sent an email about inaccurate destinations.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Eric, apologies for the inconvenience this may have caused. We have now highlighted this to the relevant team and will look into it. Thank you' ^Harry

scraped_reviews.content: This is the app to have for navigation. I found it to have better routing than Google and Waze. It does fall short on finding business sometimes, but if you have the street address it will get you there. An unexpected surprise was the live traffic. I have enjoyed using TomTom GO for the past month during the free trail. I don't travel enough to justify paying for it, though I am tempted. If I do have the need in the future I won't hesitate to subscribe.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Jason, thank you for choosing TomTom and providing candid feedback about your experience with the App. :) ^Karen

scraped_reviews.content: I attempted to renew the subscription, paid for it, but app won't update. A bar on the top says something about "Purchase Waiting" or some such thing, but tapping it does nothing; and because their support team doesn't work weekends, no help is available. I got a refund from Google and will be uninstalling when the present subscription runs out. Why pay for that kind of non-support? I may as well use a free app. It's a shame because it was my favorite navigation app overall. Oh well.

This app leaves a lot to be desired. First of all, it really struggles to log into the right account (not sure if that's because I have more than one email or not) once I'm finally logged in (which takes so long because once you try the wrong credentials once, it's stuck on a loop where there is no obvious lot out button) then halfway through my trip an ad booted me from my map and I had to pull over to try to get it to work again (I actually couldn't get it to work again. Waste of money. Sad.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Candylee, we're sorry for any bad experience you've had. For clarification, can you please tell us more about what Ad was exactly played in the app? Thanks' ^Harry

scraped_reviews.content: When you minimize the screen to use any other function like phone, music app, book app etc, the app reroutes you to what it thinks may be the fastest not what you have already chosen, to maybe avoid the school district when it will be congested halfway through your commute, just because it isn't now. Then it doesn't let you look ahead enough to plan which lane to be in, even when it's almost immediate if you're going 75mph on the interstate, 800 yards goes quickly, then zooms out at odd times.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Desiree, We apologize for the routing issue - Could you please help us with the exact route details? Start point and the finish point? Also, let us know about the downloaded maps. We will look into it. Thanks' ^Rahyl

scraped_reviews.content: I haven't used it. I just looked at the price. $20 per month for trucks? I might as well pay for Trucker Path which does a lot more. I guess I'll keep using Copilot. (Also, $5 a month for autos? You do know Google and Waze are free, right? I have yet to find an app for car navigation that is anywhere close to those 2. Even truck drivers pull it up for real time traffic conditions.)
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello there, We would like to know more about the issue - send us a DM via our Social Media channel www.twitter.com/TomTom or contact us here https://bit.ly/2XAL8wi Thanks' ^Rahyl

scraped_reviews.content: This app sucks. The only gimmick is showing which lane you should be in, but even that isn't very helpful since it doesn't show which lane of an exit to be in for the next turn, which Google maps does. Speed limits were wrong, default view when not navigating is way zoomed out, traffic patterns were wrong, zero speed trap warnings, and speech to text is a digital voice from the 1980s. Save your money, Google Maps and Waze, both free, are better in every way.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi David, sorry to know that it didn't meet your expectations. Exit Lane: Is it related to motorway exits or secondary roads? In the app's settings, Appearance, motorway exit should be enabled. Speed limits: Share a few examples. Map view: Tap the compass icon to change the view. Speed Camera: Check the warning settings. Voice: Feedback noted ^Jas

scraped_reviews.content: I just installed the app and downloaded the maps. The maps are comically bad. I live in city of 35,000 in Japan and the map shows all of 10 streets, out of hundreds. 95% or more of the streets are just plain missing. The street I live on, the larger street it branches off of, and the main street that branches off are all just not there--it just shows an arrow plowing along through nothingness, as if I were driving through a huge forest instead of a dense quasi-urban area. Even the major national expressways are missing. Maybe it's better in a few major cities, but if you installed this and tried it out in a big city and thought it was fine, you'd be up a creek once you got past the city limits if you were relying on this app..
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there. There is no map of Japan included in the app, sorry about that. ^TomTom Team

scraped_reviews.content: it's okay. the mobile version is good but it's needing some UI stuff. for example the exit numbers are very small and hard to notice, when you turn at a light it's very difficult to see which turning lane to go through nor did I understand what it was for at the beginning of using this app. there are a some suggestions that could prove to be useful but for the most part I just had to cancel my subscription
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, sorry for the letdown. Exit numbers: The font size is integrated with the phone's settings. Just change it to the bigger size and check. Lane guidance: We have moving lane gudidance- zoom in at the junctions on motorways. A bit more details would be much appreciated it. Your input is invaulable to us. Thanks, ^Jas

scraped_reviews.content: Took all of 5 min after installing this to realize how bad it is. You want how much for a subscription? Compared to lower cost and even free options, this is by far the worst nav app I have ever seen. Everything from the few and worthless settings, to the map itself. Doesn't even have street names on my area, when ALL others do.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi David, sorry to hear about your first experience. Please check if all the required map zones are downloaded, refer to this link: https://bit.ly/3Vr7Xii. If you have any further queries/ concerns, we'll be happy to look into them. Have a good one. ^Jas

scraped_reviews.content: They claim it will allow you to set the specifics (height, length) of your vehicle see pictures above, But they don't tell you that it is not an available feature on the basic plan. It is a premium upgrade. So, If you were planning on using this for your van or camper DON'T. As to how it works? Don't know. When I called to talk to customer support about how it was advertised, they gave me directions on how to cancel my subscription.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello there, Indeed you can add the vehicle dimension to the app - You will need a truck subscription in order to enable the truck profile in the app. Once done you should be able to navigate with the Camper vehicle. If you wish to know more please let us know. Thanks' ^Rahyl

scraped_reviews.content: I'm with Neil J!! This used to be a killer app. You'd pay your $21.99 a year and get timely map updates for the whole U.S. or beyond, and it was a done deal. NOW...it's a nightmare. You have to add each state individually, which in and of itself isn't so bad but when you try to add more than a few states at a time, even though the app allows you to do it, you only get a fraction of the states you've selected. Then you have to go back and add and add. Wash. Rinse. Repeat. And it keeps locking up when it's initializing the maps. It's just a nightmare. Also, I have 4 phones and only ONE of them got the "New and Improved" version, while the other 3 still said I had to pay $21.99!! I put in my identification information and it STILL said I had to pay to upgrade, even though I'd already paid the new yearly price of $12.99, auto renewable, for the one phone that got the update. The price is good, but the product is in the crapper now. FIX IT folks! A.S.A.P.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Sam - Sorry to hear about the app issue. Could you please let us know the issues with the new app so that we can help you further? ^Allen, TomTom Team.

scraped_reviews.content: Forces you to sign up for 7 day trial followed by $5 per month. You must do this before you can even see the app. You can't preview or decide about the app untill after you have provided payment info. And on top of that you also are notified that there will be ads too. No Thanks. Way too greedy and aggressive.... Uninstalled
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Swiftelk, we appreciate you taking the time to send us a feedback. It will be passed on to our developers and product managers. Thank you' ^Harry

scraped_reviews.content: I have a Pumpkin Android 8.1 head unit, the old version of this app ran well, had a few minor bugs. The new version crashes every time I start navigating to any destination I have uninstalled and reinstalled twice, once using the method described in a reply in another review here recently. Nothing has worked. At this point my only options are put my old device back in my truck and deal with a second display, or load one of the free nav apps. EDIT: Why would you not test the app on Android head units?
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there Tom. Sorry to hear about the trouble you've had. Unfortunately the app has not been tested on Android head units, so we can't guarantee compatibility with the device you have, sorry about that. ^Conor, TomTom

scraped_reviews.content: Works well with Android Auto. I prefer it over AmiGO which is also by TomTom. Search engine works well and download maps makes for an overall smoother experience when a network signal is weak or non existent. Subscription price is reasonable for what you get. Only thing I'd like to see is the ability for the app to tell you whether your destination is on the left or right when you arrive.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Edwin, thank you for your positive review. We have logged your suggestion and it will be passed on to our developers and product managers. TomTom carefully considers customer feedback when developing new features and updates. Have a safe time on the road. üòä ^Harry

scraped_reviews.content: I've been using this app on Android since it was first released. So much better than the free alternatives. One thing though - when running on Android Auto and in an average-speed zone, I don't get the display showing my average speed, which is shown on the phone screen. This is a very useful feature - can it be added to the Android Auto display?
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback, Keith. We're dedicated to improving the GO Navigation app based on user input. We will forward it to the relevant team for review. Have a good one. ^Jas

scraped_reviews.content: This app would be a 5 star app if it had updated truck stop locations and showed the time of arrival based on the timezone you will be in instead of the one you are in. It has caused me to be late because of the latter flaw which messes up trip planning. I've been inconvenienced by passing up truck stops that I could have used the restroom or eaten and fueled at. Please fix that and it'll get 5 stars and more drivers to spend money with you.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Odis, we are grateful that you took the time out to leave us a review. Thanks for bringing this to our attention! We rely on input such as this to make us aware of things that can be done better. We appreciate your feedback. ^Nikita

scraped_reviews.content: Note 20 Ultra 5G. This app sucks. Most of the time, the app won't run. Most of the time it says "Your subscription has expired" or "Oops". I wasted almost 70 dollars. "Update" I did the clear cache the first time. It started working after the 3rd or 4th restart. The live traffic didn't work as well as Google Maps btw. The second day I tried to use it, it wouldn't start. That's when I decided to get a refund. Thanks for approving my refund.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Maury, thanks for letting us know the situation. This is an unusual scenario and if you had lent us a bit more time, we would have resolved it. Apologies for the unintended hassles. Feel free to reach out to us if you have app-related queries. We'll be happy to assist you. Have a good one. ^Jas

scraped_reviews.content: This app is totally worthless. Can't put in addresses, can't do searches. I mean you can put them in but nothing ever comes up to the point you can't even start navigation. Waste of time and download. This happens for all addresses, all states, all locations. I can't share addresses since it happens to everything. I loved the app as it isn't usable. Yes all maps were downloaded and installed.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Mickey, Thank you for confirming this with us. We would request you to please contact us via https://bit.ly/2XAL8wi so we can take the necessary details from you and help you in the best possible way. ^Harry

scraped_reviews.content: Review update.. After discovering I needed to select "Whole Map" I haven't had any issues with locations not found! Sometimes I don't get sound but I think it's an issue with my phone. Good app and works great with "GPS Only". Turn off data and use offline maps. No brainer! Well worth the cost of app. Update....sound issue solved, problem was in my settings. 5 Stars.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Fantastic to hear that you have been able to enjoy the app since discovering the Whole Map search function - this is better unless you want to look in a specific town / city. Glad the sound issue has now been solved too! Safe travels, - TomTom Team

scraped_reviews.content: I didn't like the fact that it doesn't let you know on time where to turn. If you're new in the area or just visiting, you would easily get lost, and it doesn't indicate to you on time which lane you should be. if you put a new destination, it's kind of hard to put it. it's kind of complicated, why we have to pay 2x. 1st to subscribe 25, then for truck route almost 80 a year. The only thing I like is that they indicate which are truck route
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Vicky, thanks for the feedback and we sincerely regret for the unintended grievance caused. For investigation purposes, could you please confirm if you experience this problem with the instructions when using the app via android auto or on your smartphone? ^Harry

scraped_reviews.content: It does at a price just what other free apps do for free. It loads very very slow and also rerouting is slow if you deviate from the given route. There is no maps colors to chose from and only one UGLY map color is offered for day and one for night view unlike other free apps that offer nice colors to chose from. Update: in response to the developer answer. I do have a paid version and up to date, but there is no way to change the map COLOR. Answer me about the MAP color not the App color
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Aziz,

Unfortunately aside from the interface and menu colour change, it's not possible to change the other colours in the app.

Sorry to hear that this is causing frustration with you using it

- TomTom Team

scraped_reviews.content: Decent app, a little clunky, but I do like the 3d mode. Still doesnt hold a candle to maps or waze. I am unable to just drop a point and navigate. It has to be a "legitimate" address. I work in construction and maps arent that up to date. I also work, hunt, and fish in the country and need to pick a spot just past the curve where the blind is at for example
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi & thanks for the review

If you wish to navigate to specific point on the map without using search function, press and hold your finger on the map. Press the icon with 3 dots and select 'navigate to'

Sorry to hear you've found some out of date info with our maps. You can alert us to this via
https://www.tomtom.com/mapshare/tools/

- TomTom Team

scraped_reviews.content: Not very user friendly if you are driving, you can't search for destination by name of location you need to know exact address only. You can tell the GPS take me to a store and name the city (there is only one in the city) it doesn't work, i.e. take me to Costco in Bonney Lake. Also one time we type the address of another location and it was not found either. I had a year subscription but canceled it because of this fact.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Jeff, We may need some additional details to look into it further - send us a DM via our Social Media channels: www.twitter.com/TomTom or www.facebook.com/TomTomDrivers. Thanks' ^Rahyl

scraped_reviews.content: The ETA's it gives are constantly inaccurate (47 minutes for a 12 mile drive? what!?). Searching for fuel stations to fill up my big rig at gives the description "stations below serve fuel for your vehicle" above a list, but finding diesel isn't the issue, it's the fact that there's no way to tell IF MY TRUCK WILL EVEN FIT IN ANY OF THE PARKING LOTS of all the listed gas stations!!! The truck stop search filter RARELY shows fuel prices. Doesn't show when weigh stations are open or closed.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Charles, Thanks for the feedback - We would love to work on your provided suggestion about the truck app improvements. We have shared your feedback internally with the team and if we have any update on this, we will let you know via a release notes. Thanks' ^Rahyl

scraped_reviews.content: I drive a commercial van in the NY, NJ, CT area I can't drive on most parkways with a commercial vehicle. With this app, I can remove those parkways from the trip list and I can drive safely and get where I am going fast. Commercial or truck GPS will cost way more and take longer trips to get were you need to go. After trying a few apps, in my opinion, this one was the best for commercial vans and light trucks.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi there!

Great to hear that you are enjoying this app :)

Just so you know, the app hasn't been designed specifically for large vehicles - for optimum peace of mind we recommend taking a look at our stand-alone series of Go Professional devices - suitable for vans and commercial vehicles.

Cheers,

- Cameron at TomTom

scraped_reviews.content: I re-download it and it still take anywhere from 1 to 2 minutes every time I open it up. I know its not my phone because none of my other app do this. A minute or so may seem small but if I want to go somewhere like know I don't want to haft to wait to do so. So I would not recommend this app if you are in a hurry just Google it, it works much faster. Other than that so far the map works just haft to wait if you want to go anywhere.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: I'm terribly sorry! For security reasons, we're unable to access the account details via Review, but we'd certainly like to ensure this is investigated. When you have a moment, please provide us with some additional details here: https://bit.ly/2MOGIQt and a member of our team can provide additional assistance here. ^Fiona

scraped_reviews.content: No longer usable. I drive to multiple locations each day for work and can now no longer trust the routing nor the estimated arrival time. It frequently tries to send me on routes that I know are wrong that would add an additional drive time of 20 minutes for a 45 minute drive. Even if it sends me on an acceptable route the estimated arrival time is off by a similar amount of time. 70 minutes estimated this morning and I arrived in 48. No traffic. Quickest route with no tolls used at all times
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Michael, Thank you for your answer. I have passed it on to our developers. If they ask, could you please give me some examples of routes where you see those errors (start and end)? Thank you and kind regards, C√©sar

scraped_reviews.content: I can't believe they actually want to charge for this. It's such a bad navigation app they should be paying me to use it. The interface is awkward and clunky. The maps themselves are incomplete, not showing smaller/ minor roads, and it's an expedition just to figure out how to report an error on the map. No thanks.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi M P, sorry to hear about your experience with the app. To verify the details again, please click the link, https://mydrive.tomtom.com/. Also, be sure all the required map zones are downloaded, https://bit.ly/3Vr7Xii. To report map-related errors, we have MapShare tool, https://bit.ly/37HHB7x. For user interface, feedback is noted üëç ^Jas

scraped_reviews.content: It's the best navigation app there is out there. Has clear guidance and nice layout. Samantha is the best voice in all my gps apps. I use it in my phone and my head unit in the car. My disappointment is that the car icon is gone. I only have the triangle symbol for position. Also the map always starts and defaults in 2D rather than 3D, who uses 2D? It's tedious to have to choose 3D every time the car starts and a trip ends.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Hezron, Thanks for bringing this to our attention! We rely on input such as this to make us aware of things that can be done better. We appreciate your feedback. ^Rahyl

scraped_reviews.content: $20 wasted. I gave this app a try when they offered a free trial a couple years ago. I only decided to try it again because hammer was starting to glitch. I thought paying more would get better quality. I was wrong. I hate this app. You have to download every state you're going through. And if you don't it can't find your destination. Places I've been delivering to for 2 years... Tomtom says no route possible. Or it can't find the location at all
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Luke, We apologize for the routing issue - Could you please help us with the exact route details? Start point and the finish point? Also, let us know about the downloaded maps. We will look into it. Thanks' ^Rahyl

scraped_reviews.userName: K. D. M. TOP COP 72 (Fruit Bat)
scraped_reviews.content: I truly believe if you want more people to try something, then let them try something. But having to give up your credit info in hopes that people forget to cancel a trial and you keep charging them four or five months when they realize what the heck. That's really below a company of your caliber. It's a 100% HARD PASS/NO for me being that Google Maps are constantly updated, FREE, and yours are not. So until maps are consistently current and a trial doesn't require a credit card.... NOPE
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, we're sorry to learn that you're not happy with our paywall. We have passed on your feedback & disappointment to our product managers. Thank you' ^Harry

scraped_reviews.content: Works well. Traffic problems reported fast. Reroutes to avoid problems good. ETA very good, it would be nice to customize the message automatically. It needs a vehicle type option. My van & trailer are not premeditated on "Express Lanes". Toll roads yes, Express no. The program will repeatedly try to redirect me to the Express lane. 50 miles of this with a redirect every mile gets old.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Antonio, Thank you for leaving an valuable feedback about the App - we will take care of the improvement to provide the best possible services. Safe travels! ^Steve, Tomtom

scraped_reviews.content: Truck portion is severely lacking. To many things need to be fixed to list them all... Examples: Wrong speed limits, only weight for two axles, no weigh stations, no scales, truck routes incorrect, no way to report needed fixes. Has a long way to go. Seems like they released it just to get subscribers. Not worth any money at the moment.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, we are sorry to hear about your experience. Normally, the problems you describe should not occur. Could you please help us with one of the start and destination addresses set in the app when this issue was observed and the preferred route type, vehicle dimension setting set on your phone so we can take a look. Thanks' ^Harry

scraped_reviews.content: Worthless at best. I decided to give it a try after reading an article about it. It was working fine while I was testing it on short trips. Loved the fact that I could change the colors and personalize it. Took a plane from Denver to Salt Lake and rented a car. I fired the app up for directions to my dedti action and the maps was blank and the speed display was in KM. I re-downloaded the North America map and refreshed the map. Still blank. No money from me. Waste of time and space on my phone.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Benjamin! It sounds like not all necessary zones are installed to the phone. The app update features a different type of mapping where zones need to be installed separately. To install extra zones please go to Main Menu - Maps - Add, and add all zones for your country. Then, you should be able to plan routes effectively! ^TomTom Team

scraped_reviews.content: I agree with many other comments, the app was awesome before and worth paying. This updated version is junk. Doesn't show what side of the road the destination will be on. Drops me at wrong locations. The zip codes are no longer correct with the cities. Not sure if I'll be paying for this anymore.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Joshua - Sorry for the inconvenience caused. I request you to report this via below link so that we can add this to our new update. - https://www.tomtom.com/mapshare/tools/new/mapshare/ ‚Ä¢ TomTom Team

title: Fishdom
description:
Dive into the fantastic world of Fishdom! You're in for an ocean of exciting levels, scores of adorable fish and pets, and a sea of captivating events!
 
Explore incredible underwater adventures! Unlock aquariums and decorate them to your taste, creating perfect homes for cute fish and their friends.
 
Game Features:
‚óè Original gameplay: beat match-3 levels to create the perfect home for your fish!
‚óè Thousands of captivating levels with powerful boosters!
‚óè Loads of beautiful decorations and unlimited creative freedom: what the aquariums look like is entirely up to you!
‚óè Exciting events: embark on expeditions, collect keys in season adventures, and get awesome rewards like power-ups, boosters, unlimited lives, pets, and aquarium decorations!
‚óè Have fun together: compete against other players, team up, and win fantastic prizes! Play with your Facebook friends, or make new friends in the game community!
 
Fishdom is free to play, but some in-game items can be purchased for real money.
 
A Wi-Fi or internet connection is not required to play.
 *An internet connection is required to access competitions and additional features."
 
Do you like Fishdom? Follow us!
Facebook: facebook.com/Fishdom 
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/fishdom_mobile/ 

Need to report an issue or ask a question? Contact Player Support through the game by going to Settings > Help and Support. If you can't access the game, use the web chat by clicking the chat icon in the lower right corner of our website: https://playrix.helpshift.com/hc/en/4-fishdom/

Privacy Policy:
https://playrix.com/privacy/index.html

Terms of Use:
https://playrix.com/terms/index.html
